text: I always have good food when I come here. it's a great local place with a nice patio for breakfast. you have to have an open mind when coming here, as there are some "unusual" menu items, but the staff is always accommodating. it's great for breakfast and dinner!

We frequent hillside spot and generally love it-  I do have to say however, that I have found the food to be pretty inconsistent. There are times when I order something that I've had before and it is completely different then the last time I had it.  I know a lot of people complain about the slow service but that is actually one of the things that I enjoy about this little kitschy place- it is laid back and my friends and I can go sit for hours.  The servers are great and friendly and I love the atmosphere- I would just love to see more consistency in the food.

The food is delicous, but a little pretentious for my taste. The crowd is a bit foodie-alternative which also was a little snooty for us to just chill out and relax. The service was a bit slow  None of us had the BBQ, but we smelled like it all day after leaving (it smells great in the restaurant) so I assume that it is quite good.  The ingredients are all fresh and locally sourced for the most part which feels good to purchase and good for the local economy.  All-in-all, not really my cup of tea, but a great asset for Ahwatukee for those who are looking for a local, fresh culinary adventure.

I would give this place 5 stars if the device wasn't so terrible. If you go to eat there you can't be in a hurry or expect excellent service. There has been a time where my husband and I eventually got our own drinks. Even other regulars know you can count on amazing food and terrible service. But the food is amazing and keep bringing me back. It makes the lack of service all worth it. The carne asada torta is one oft favorites. And the Brooklyn chop is a great salad. I will always recommend eating here, even of you do have to get your own drink.
This  is my "go-to" place when I'm in town for breakfast. Great food, awesome long term staff, good gluten free options.

This place could be great, but needs a little improvement, especially on the weekends.  During the week, it's a terrific spot to grab a late breakfast, coffee, and even get a some work done on wi-fi.  You can order at the counter and they are pretty quick with bringing out your drinks & food.  Have ordered the granola, croque madam, oatmeal and a variety of espresso drinks, and all have been tasty.  Weekends, however, are a different story.  They are usually understaffed with servers (who are hard to pick out from patrons since there is no dress code to distinguish), and waiting 30 minutes just for a table to have a simple breakfast is not cool.  They don't have counter service on the weekends so you are at the mercy of waiting to be seated, and then waiting longer for order taking & food.  Been there a couple times for dinner, also very good, with the exception of getting old versions of the menu which have items they don't make anymore.  Loved their fresh halibut.  It doesn't seem that there is ever a "manager" there on weekends who could make sure the place runs well.

We expected a long wait after we read the reviews before heading over for breakfast on the 4th of July...great service! And great food. Farmer's omelettes, breakfast burrittos and pancakes. We were are really impressed! We look forward to going again. But, please... Don't let the secret out about this gem! LOL
Great coffee, phenomenal pancakes, and the rest of their menu is delicious...but the service is lacking.
Perfect spot for a laid back breakfast any day of the week. Staff is friendly & service is fast. Try the "El Jefe" omelet, great flavors and not too much food either...goldilocks would be pleased!

This place needs to take some lessons in customer service. Hillside Spot is slow. It takes forever to get your food. I have been there 3 times, 1 time when they were busy and the other 2 when it was slow. Every time I had to wait over 15 minutes to order and over 30 for my food. I have worked in the restaurant businees for 30 years. I have never seen a restaurant so disorganized when they are busy. They need to have a manager on the floor taking care of things. I did not see one person in charge following up on problems. Chef Gordon Ramsey needs to save this place before it goes down the drain. The only reason this place is still in business is because there is no competition for it. Ahwatukee residents are desperate for a good local restaurant and they are willing to put up with bad service and cold food because there is nothing else around to compete with it. Good Luck on improving or just get out of of the business!

Went here for breakfast Aug12, 2017. Took 30 minutes to get food. It was not hot when we got it. The server never came to refill coffee. Had to flag another server down. Also, didn't asked how the food was after we received it. We weren't the only ones with cold food. The customers next to us were saying the same exact thing. Food was mediocre. Coffee not hot either. Noisy place, but most are.
Great Breakfast spot. Sat outside, beautiful weather. Had a couple of eggs, bacon and toast, side of sliced avocados and tomatoes. Really good cappuccino.

Living in South Phoenix, we have to travel to get a larger selection of restaurants. We often go to Ahwatukee for dinner but for some reason we have missed this little gem. I was specifically looking for breakfast at 4pm and they serve breakfast all day. I ordered the special which was a light crepe, filled with creme fresh topped with fresh strawberries, bananas, blueberries, I had a pancake too which was served with whipped butter and a very nice thick syrup. Because its fall and it was 4pm, I also had the fall sangria. Light, apple cider flavor with fall spices it was very tasty. Our service was top rate and sitting outside was comfortable. Looking forward to trying more of their menu!

Ate dinner there last night.  Wait staff was okay, first as soon as we were sitting down was on us about what beer or wine, then when our final party joined us was asking what we wanted to eat.  Felt rushed..then poof she disappeared until the check was do.  With that out of the way,   I ordered the 1/2 chicken it was tasty as was the side salad.  The Macaroni Cheese was plain, nothing great about it so skip that.    My friends order the chicken salad the salmon, both were good.    Overall food and atmosphere was okay.

I love Hillside for breakfast and come whenever I can.  The meat they use is of a very high quality, and makes everything amazing. The Levain bread is really fantastic. Basically everything food related is great.  The problem, as many have noted, is in Hillside's service. I've had a number of servers who have been very good, so it's not a systemic issue.   But, that being said, there are a number of servers who are about as bad as it gets. They won't come to take your order until you've been there almost 15 minutes. They drop the food off and you'll never see them again unless you flag them down and almost yell to them. These folks aren't unfriendly, but they're also not exactly caring about your experience.  So, you're left with the feelings that I have: hope that Yelp gets the management weeds out the poor servers, so this place can be the 5 stars it should be.

I came to Hillside last night and I can't figure out what all of these positive reviews are about. I ordered the mesquite grilled chicken which came with two sides - I chose mac n cheese and stir fried veggies. First of all, they charge $4.75 for a side MAC N CHEESE out of a BLUE BOX, which should be a freaking crime. That is the kind of crap you find on a chain restaurant kids' menu... YUCK! Making a decent mac n cheese from scratch is not that hard, guys. The veggies were complete mush - nothing you would expect when you read "stir fried veggies". Last, there was the chicken. Sigh. There was some sort of goo that they slather on it - it is sticky sweet - and it condenses down as it cooks, then sticks to your teeth when you eat it. Oh yeah, the chicken was very, very pink close to the bone.   Maybe this is more of a breakfast place? Perhaps I just got unlucky and had three terrible things on the menu? In any event, it will be difficult for me to try this place again.  I still can't believe they serve Kraft mac n cheese and charge $4.75 for a side of it. Laughable.
I love this place for breakfast. The staff is great. I have been there twice and had a great experience both times.  I will be back in the next few days.

Had dinner on the patio with live music last night and breakfast there this morning.  I have to say many of the bad reviews really piss me off.  Good food takes time people!  If you want fast and cheap, go to  McD's across the parking lot. The food here is better than anything else in Ahwatukee.  I don't mind waiting and the servers are relaxed and friendly.   Don't change a thing!  If the people who don't like it here stop coming, more great food and atmosphere for the rest of us.

I try to give a bussiness the benefit of the doubt, but I just can't do it anymore for this place. I have been here 4 times. Each time the service was crap. The first time I was here was on mother's day. I understand that places are busy on this day so I tried not to judge based on that visit. I went there 3 more times. Each time the place wasn't even busy! It takes forever for someone to notice you because it is a seat yourself type of place. At least it was everytime I was there. If you want a drink refilled you should order 2 drinks because it will take forever for someone to come back to your table. If you're not in any type of hurry and could care less about good service then come here. Good food but absolutely HORRIBLE service. I will never eat here again based on the service alone.

My wife and I and some friends went there a couple of weeks ago. Where do I begin? It took nearly 45 min. to get our food from the time we were seated, during which we had no drink refills. I ordered a burger medium rare which came darn near well done and completely flavorless. My wife had a ribeye sandwich. The flavor of the steak was smothered by some overpowering sweet, salty sauce or marinade which completely ruined it. My friend had macaroni and cheese and it was pretty similar to Kraft White Cheddar Mac and Cheese, but with far less flavor.   The only reason this place gets two stars is because of the bread that the sandwiches were served on was really good and the guacamole appetizer was a 4 out of 5.  I will not be going back.

Worst service I have ever had, food was wrong and cold this was the only time I have ever not paid for party of a meal due to it not being edible. I was with a group of five and only two of the orders came out right and they were very simple kids meals if the three remaining orders one was cold one was messed up and one was completely wrong sad to say I will not patronize this establishment again.

Seating service is always a little slow because they don't want to put too much pressure on the service staff.  So, sometimes you have to wait for no reason. Food is always good.  Nice breakfast spot for the weekends!  Good patio seating.

This place was great for breakfast.  Tried it for dinner and it was delicious.  I had the special halibut.  It was cooked perfectly and a nice piece of fish.   I love the ambiance of this place and the fact that they source local products.  Thumbs up!

The menu here is so eclectic that you might think it wouldn't be good but everything my party had was amazing! The waitress recommended the spicy tuna rice bowl and I am so thankful that she did because it was delicious. It was pretty much an unwrapped spicy tuna roll and came with a delicious side salad. I also ordered the special mac and cheese which came with chiles and chorizo and was so creamy and cheesy with a bit of spice. So good! Two of my dining guests ordered the ribs and noted that they fell off of the bone and were delectable. Two others got the pulled pork sandwich and spoke about its amazingness for the rest of the night. The service was amazing and the ambiance was great for a casual dinner. Definitely recommend. Everyone in your party will find food on the menu that they will like and to be honest I can't get that Mac and cheese off of my mind!

The croque monsiuer (madame) and all their sopas are what I would reccomend for someone who wants to indulge in something fresh and flavorful without over indulging.  My girlfriend tried the apple compote pancakes which were disappointing. We were expecting pancakes topped with  an apple jam of sorts but the topping turned out looking like they just sliced some apples and put them on top. Very big letdown but still 4/5 because of other redeeming dishes and the atmosphere that makes you feel like you are eating at a place trying to stay secret. (AKA hipster.)

Stopped in this am for a quick breakfast with my wife and 4 yr old. My little guy was being a crab, so we didn't get to truly enjoy it, but what we had was really good. We don't live all that close, but we would go again...

Based on a review in PHX Magazine, I decided to stop by Hillside Spot for breakfast today.  Not a good choice.   I ordered Mia's Pancakes, a blackberry muffin, and regular coffee.  The muffin was good, but not spectacular.  The coffee was bad - it tasted metallic and "off" for lack of a better word.  Then my pancakes arrived...they were large, but not tasty.  The pancakes were too eggy, soggy, and SALTY!  It was bizarre.  I ate three bites and then left.   I don't know if I was there on a bad day, but it was terrible and I was very surprised since it received good reviews.

Hipster alert!!!  I went there recently with the intention of getting a salad. Unfortunately I couldn't find anything that resembled one.  All of them included fruit (i.e. pears, mango) and a list of exotic ingredients, including dressings such as jalapeno cucumber raspberry vinaigrette (come on). It would seem that this place is trying way too hard. It's one thing to offer new foods and exciting twists on traditional stuff, but it's another to just throw together a bunch of unique-sounding ingredients in hopes to dupe the next bohemian with an identity crisis into overpriced mediocrity.  If the hipsters of Ahwatukee would just get over themselves this place wouldn't be all that popular.

The spot chop salad is my favorite.  They also have a great pulled pork sandwich.  They buy from local vendors, so I like to support them.   The restaurant is open and urban.  The service is not there strong suit, but give them a try.

I have come here many times and want desperately to support the local ahwatukee commerce and small business owners... I have been seated on the patio almost every time which is fine, however I would offer several suggestions: 1. Clean the patio up There is so much junk at the back of the patio that it looks like bulk pick up is late picking up.  Not so bad if there weren't tables directly next to these items.    2. Get rid of the flies At the time of this report there are 7 flies sitting on our table alone.  There so comfortable on this patio that they are too lazy to fly around- they live here.  It is a constant problem and again highlights that the patio is unacceptably dirty.  Again, clean it up.  3. Change your menu even slightly. The food is good and there is potential. Would be nice to add variety.  Although I cannot recommend hillside spot secondary to the above reasons, I hope that they can do these necessary improvements to survive.

I know I only gave this spot 3 stars, but here's why. I come here almost every Sunday after hiking south mountain. It has fantastic lattes, way better than Starbucks, and the food is delicious too. However, the prices here are way too high for the amount of food/drink you get, and the service can occasionally be slow, depending on how busy it is. They do not handle busy times well, although they are much better than they used to be. The most disappointing thing about this place is that they no longer allow dogs in their nice side patio, so after my hike with my dog, I have to sit near the front door which downgrades my experience a bit. I still go here frequently despite all of the above as it really is a decent place for breakfast. Btw the mimosas are to die for!

NOT A HIPSTER = NOT WELCOME!! Stand-offish staff of world weary 20 year olds. Can be 10% full and customers ignored. (Today there were 3 other tables with people). I'm *always* kind with servers, they have a difficult job. However, my server today came up to my table with the worst attitude I've ever had in a server.   Now she gets some kudos for making the effort to walk over to my table. However, her face indicated that I was obviously intruding on her. I politely asked her to repeat what she said b/c I could not hear her (like a lot of other people, I sometimes have a little trouble hearing with background noise. Plus she was kind of standing behind me and not really talking to my face).   I'd obviously crossed the line--this was going to require 10 seconds of her time. She got really sharp with me, rolled her eyes, sighed, etc. I was frustrated & was rude in return, which is completely out of character for me. Went in for some quiet time after work, left with a knot in my stomach.  I wanted so badly to like this place, I've tried it 5-6 times over the years. Probably stay in business b/c of morons like me. No more. Service/attitude consistently bad. Very, very, very unwelcoming, no eye contact, smiles--you know, things that come naturally to most folks.  The reviews indicate that service has been an issue for years. Given that they are doing nothing to improve it, I can only hope they go out of business so a more deserving business can use the cool little space.  NOTE TO PERSONS WITH SERVICE ANIMALS: You may wish to read a review further down indicating that an individual's service dog was not welcome here.
No matter how good the food is or how awesome the drinks are... It comes doesn't to service..   15 min wait to get two coffees???  Too slow IN my opinion.   I'll look elsewhere from here on out

I want to love this place, but as many before me have written, the service is some of the worst that I have ever had. It's as if the servers feel like they are doing you a favor by bringing your food and drink. The shame of it is that the food is really good. We would go to the Hillside a lot if the service were even just a little better. Oh well.
Nice patio

One of my favorite spots to eat in Ahwatukee.  I love how they use a lot of locally sourced ingredients.  Everything that I've tried on the menu has been good.  I highly recommend the Asado Chicken Salad, the Suki Rice Bowl (with spicy tuna), the pulled pork sandwich & the corn on the cob. Lots of bottled craft brews to pick from and some local brews on tap.  Great spot for breakfast too.  I like the coffee and iced teas here....
Here's the thing... The food is amazing, but the service is hit or miss. I've vowed never to come back many times. The food (and my kids' love of it) always brings me back. Get the pancakes!

Normally the Hillside Spot is on point. Disappointingly that was not the case this evening. We we're meet at the door by a rude "dude bro" I have never seen before who told us the kitchen was closed. I say that I have never seen him before because. We eat there almost every Sunday morning after our group runs and again on Thursday nights. The funny thing is we had to walk across the parking lot and place our order at zips and post this before 8 p.m. The time they are supposed to be closing! Time to rethink our post run dinning choice.

this should have no stars... they have nothing traditional, no french toast , no corn beef hash, etc.. I asked for 2 eggs with the yellows juicy and the whites cooked (no boogers). he said over medium. i said ok, I asked for bacon and sour dough bread with butter. My eggs came out over hard no juice and my bacon burn, the toast was hard burnt and cold so could not absorb the butter.  I would never recommend this place to anyone other than my inlaws!!0 forgot to tell you about the coffee I had to ask three times for a refill and each time it was cold.. he actually touched my mug and i told him to taste it as it was cold... should have poured it on ,me to prove to him....

Have stopped at Hillside several times after hiking South Mountain for coffee and scones.  Noticed they had "Friday Fish Fry" on menu. Decided to try.  What a mistake. Very bland, not seasoned fish, soggy French fries.  Decided to try on Sunday for breakfast. Say hostess at front desk preparing silverware in containers.  She held knives, forks and spoons by the hilt or fork tines, spoons not by handle and placed in containers.  She also pressed silverware against her clothing and ran he fingers through her hair while sorting the silverware. Hopefully the Health Department will catch this some day.  I will no longer eat anything there that requires silverware. David A. Gilliland  P.S. Breakfast was fairly tasty.

Service, salad, beers, and burgers! All aspects were perfect. Great outdoor patio, and our server Alex gave perfect recommendations for dinner. Brunch is what HS is known for, but dinner is where it's at!!! Can't wait to try all of the other dishes!!

An oasis of real food in the chain-restaurant wasteland of Ahwatukee/south Tempe.  The service can be slow and not all the dishes for everyone the table come out at the same time, but the food it worth it when it arrives. Fresh ingredients without fancy twists serves them well.  I recommend the grilled salmon.
Open kitchen and great staff. Friendly and chilled.  Turkey sandwich. Sliced white breast havarti cheese, avocado, tomato lettuce mayo and honey mustard. With salad. And a hefeweizen.

This is my favorite breakfast & lunch place in Ahwatukee. The food is excellent. The service is friendly and they do what they do perfectly. This isn't a place to go for elegant sit down service. It's the perfect blend of self-service meets top restaurant quality food.   Have the Croque Monsieur--or add an egg to make it a Croque Madame. You will not be disappointed. The bread and the baked goods are so good you could make a substantial meal off them alone.  Finally, this is a small local business that truly cares about its community. They have shown up at two community fund raising events with huge boxes of warm, freshly baked cookies to donate. I'm grateful to have a place of this caliber in my neighborhood.
This place rocks. Between the friendly wait staff to their fantastic pancakes and Mexican inspired food, this is a winner. Try it.

Great cafe with friendly service. We enjoyed the "el gallo" torta. & almond coffee cake on the perfect shaded patio.  My wife and I really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere and great eats.  Can't wait to try the Spot for dinner!

Hillside spot is a great place for lunch. I have been there twice. First time I had the burger, which was juicy and everything I needed to cure my hangover. The second time I went for a healthier option and got the suki rice bowl - holy cow was I blown away. Perfect size and tasty! It comes with a small salad which was also very good. My boyfriend got the pulled pork sandwich which had a really good smokey flavor. Besides from the food, we had the best server I have had in awhile. Her name is Erica. She was fast, nice, charming, and on top of her game. I can't wait to come back and try hillside for dinner!
I've only been for breakfast and it is delicious. Coffee is fabulous.  Be prepared to wait for a table on the weekends.  Can get a bit loud so sitting outside is ideal, when possible.

Great beer selection. Friendly wait-staff. "Free" kids meals never seem to be free until you ask for a receipt adjustment. "Happy hour discounted" drinks rarely seem to be discounted... until you ask for a receipt adjustment. And careful with ordering any sort of substitutions - this place is happy to charge extra for a similar (or lesser) side. If you're one who rarely bothers to check your bill, maybe rethink that approach when coming here.

Hillside Spot is awesome! I have only been here a couple times but the food and service haven't disappointed! The first time I sat inside and the second I sat out on the patio. I'd say the patio was my favorite, lots of shade and the service didn't lack. I've enjoyed both breakfast and lunch here and both have been great! I'm looking forward to trying out their happy hour on Thursdays next!

This restaurant is GREAT! I love the open kitchen. They use many local products and I have tried the entire breakfast menu. It is not a huge menu but what is on it is very high quality. Can't get enough! Coffee is sometimes cold, but I still give 5 stars.

Cool breakfast/brunch/lunch place! They do dinner too though! Went for breakfast one morning with the hubby. Great breakfast sandwiches! A little slow on service, however the staff are friendly and helpful. They serve local beer and wine too. We will have to go back and try dinner sometime soon.
From the roasted corn, to the carne asada burrito to the savory crepe and the croque madame  you cannot go wrong!

This place used to be relaxing with much better food and service. Tables are always sticky, dirty floors, the only bathroom is old and disgusting, flies are always flying around inside and because of the dirty stuff and droppings outside, they're there as well. Service is the worst I have seen. Every time we go there, we hope that they have improved but it just gets worse. Manager may not be aware of his crew but that's his job! As the last straw, we actually left after being seated and waited for over 35 minutes for anyone to step up and even ask if we need anything to drink or have any silverware on the table. I am sure we won't be going back and hopefully they step up their service.

One of the best breakfast places in the Valley, even at 3 in the afternoon on a Saturday.   Fantastic prices on the a la carte menu. I can get a large, delicious pancake, a side of hash browns, and coffee for under $7.   Wait staff is always rotating, but consistently friendly. Service is a bit slower on the patio than in the restaurant.

I really really want this place to be good.  We have so few good 'mom and pop' places in Ahwatukee and I had such high hopes for Hillside Spot. It has a funky ambiance, friendly staff, beautiful patio, and great neighborhood location, however, I am often so disappointed.   I met friends for coffee last week.  We sat in the corner at a wide wooden table with chairs.  Our waitress quickly greeted us and was very friendly.  It was 8am so I was eager for coffee.  It was lukewarm, watered down, lacked flavor, and not good.    I am happy with Circle K coffee and Hillside's was just plain bad. If they could make a good cup of coffee and compete with Dunkin Donuts and all the chains that plague Ahwatukee it would be a public service!   As for the food, I opted for an eye-catching pastry.  I chose a blueberry muffin.  It was dry and cold.  My friend ordered a scone and was also disappointed. I have been here about 4 times since they have opened but have been rarely pleased.  Sad to say I don't think I will give it a try again soon. It's just too heartbreaking.  Please Hillside Spot! Step it up!

My favorite spot for breakfast while in Chandler. Delicious southwest breakfast - chorizo torta, chorizo burritos.  Healthy options as well - Steel Cut Oatmeal with fresh fruit and a selection of toppings.    This place was pretty good for dinner as well;  they have a decent craft beer selection on hand.  Staff was very friendly, and attentive to us.

I have been here a few times and generally the food is pretty good. They have a lot of options for all diet types and a good beer selection. I like to get the Spot Chop salad and also have enjoyed the veggie torta. My meat eater friends like the burgers or Reuben sandwich.   The only downside is the service can be a slow even if they are not very busy. I also have been seated at a table that was not cleaned off since the previous customer and found food residue from a previous dish on my plate.

The Hillside is close to my home and makes a nice walk with the family to go there for lunch/brunch. The food there is really good and I believe almost all food  is gathered from local growers.  I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo, eggs, cheese and potatoes. The burrito was flavorful and very good. There is also a small side of fruit served with the meal. I wish the fruit was a bit bigger.  I had a bite of my wife's torta sandwich and that was really good. That might be an option next time.  There is a nice patio outside with a fireplace as well as ample seating inside.  Service was great and food came out quickly! We'll be bake there over and over sampling other items.  Nice atmsophere that is also kid friendly.
Food was amazing. Service was awful. We barley saw our waiter and the bus boy took our waters from us when we had finished but were still talking.

You'd think, wouldn't you, that with a name like Hillside Spot this restaurant in Ahwatukee would be nestled in a pastoral setting with lovely views? Not so, it's in a typical strip mall off Warner Rd. and unfortunately its patio faces directly on the street, making it hard to carry on a conversation, even on a Sunday. The patio, without misters, is uninviting, with a very odd mixture of seat cushions for the wrought iron furniture. It was even more off-putting because most of the tables were loaded with dirty dishes. There was one hard working busboy who couldn't keep up with the mess. It wasn't much better indoors - messy and noisy (the noise of the cars being replaced by very loud music).       You place your order at the counter. Breakfast is served daily from 6:30 AM to 4 PM. There are pancakes, plain or with apple compote ($6) or with bananas, caramel, creme fraiche and peanuts ($7).  Eggs, scrambled or fried, come with MJ toast and a choice of bacon, ham, sausage, or chorizo ($6).  Various egg sandwiches and omelets range from $6 to $8. But we had come for lunch. The selection was small, and not particularly inspiring. Tuna or chicken salad sandwiches ($7), turkey ($6), a BLT to which you could add a fried egg at no extra charge ($7) and a croque monsieur ($7.50). Surprisingly, none of these came with a side. The cheeseburger ($8.50) came with fries.       I ordered the rotisserie half chicken ($10) which was served with fries and seasonal local vegetables. Of course, I requested crispy fries. Ken opted for the Derby Salad, with various greens, egg, avocado, bacon, and blue cheese, served with house made buttermilk dressing ($8). We waited quite a while, when finally a server, shouting our name and number, delivered our food. The salad was good size, with loads of blue cheese chunks of good quality (rather than the generic crumbles served at many places), and large pieces of bacon. The greens were fresh and the avocado looked freshly cubed. It's a shame that the buttermilk dressing was tasteless, and the quantity skimpy. My chicken was nicely cooked, with crisp skin - much crispier, in fact, than my fries which were dark brown, but limp. The vegetables were a mix of roasted cauliflowerets, corn, and red peppers which I enjoyed.  We took home a brownie and a slice of chocolate cake. Both were excellent.       All in all, although our food was generally good, I had expected more. More ambience, a nicer setting, a more interesting menu. One of the owners of Hillside Spot also owns Gallo Blanco, a Southwestern/Mexican restaurant (our favorite) in the Clarendon Hotel in downtown Phoenix,. That menu, while small, is full of interesting, flavorful food. The place is clean, the decor "bus station" funky. It is, however, LOUD, especially when the Flamenco dancers are in attendance. Unfortunately, the limp fries are there too. So, while we will continue to eat at Gallo Blanco, Hillside Spot is off limits for us.

I came for the fries since it was listed as top 20 places to get them in AZ. Sadly, I was disappointed. The article I read claimed the fries had the perfect balance of crispy outside, fluffy inside. Mine were limp and uninspired. I probably went through half a bottle of ketchup to eat them. I got the grilled cheese as well- meh. The fun part was the surprise chunk of bacon and four pieces of shaved lettuce in my fries. It was almost as if they dumped someone's leftover fries on my plate. Wouldn't have minded, but I don't eat pork :/  Nice staff but super slow!  I sat, starving, while I watched the people that arrived and ordered after me, happily stuffing their faces.   All in all, not worth the drive nor the wait. Sadly, I will continue to hunt for the perfect fries in AZ.

If you're looking for a local place, that uses organic local produce, this is the place for you. Everything I've tried there has been delicious. They had baked mussels one night as their local fish dish, and they were AMAZING!   I like to make a lot of my own food, so I really like it when I can find a place that you can tell used fresh ingredients. Definitely try the guacamole!  They also have  a few beers on tap, and live music I think once a week. Saturdays maybe? I haven't checked that out yet.  They also serve Cartel Coffee Lab roasted coffee so this is a great spot to stop off and get your caffeine fix.  4 stars because I have seen, and heard, a few things about bad service. It can at times, feel like things aren't running as smoothly or quickly as they should be. Nothing strong management couldn't correct.

I've been her far more times than I've checked in.  Had the Blue Sky burger today.  Highly recommended!  They have a great happy hour and a beer selection on the same level.  It's the season to sit outside and they have a great patio!  Great place to bring your co-workers and / or friends after work.

The only reason I come here is because of my friend who likes this place. The ambience reminds her of LA, where she's originally from, so I don't want to argue about that.  This place can be busy especially on a weekend so prepare to wait for a table for 10-15 minutes. The food is good and service isn't too bad. I am only giving them 3 stars because their menu can be deceiving. There is usually mayonnaise on their sandwich but that is not written on their menu at all. A lot of people aren't into dairy like my fiancee! When we complained about that and wrote them an email about it, there was no response from their customer service. I guess they're too busy to respond to our email.  I will come back to this place only because my friend likes it but I know there are other places out there who take care of their customers and are honest and upfront about what they put on their food!
Love Hillside Spot! I typically do weekend brunch or a late lunch and the food has always been good.

I've been to Hillside Spot a handful of times. The food has always been good, occasionally great! I love the vibe and the feel of the place, and like most, really want to support the local businessman! I agree with others...it is hard to get the rhythm down (where to get your silverware, napkins, drinks, etc.) the first couple of times...so be prepared (unless you come for the dinner service, where they actually seat and serve you). Their french fries are fantastic. One major downside are the flies (which were in full force my last visit).   Overall, definitely worth a try!

Great place! Everything is locally sourced and the ambiance is delightful. Our server Madeline was wonderful and very attentive! The food was subpar but still good. When there was an issue with our order they were nice enough to comp it and express their apologies. I will definitely be returning!   Update as of 03/11/17 Lovely place!!! The bacon and cheese burger was fantastic and our sever Erik was very nice and attentive. He was kind enough to scour the restaurant for mustard for me. Fantastic food, fantastic service. 10/10 would recommend!!!
Went for a simple breakfast Monday morning, and we're very pleased. There was no wait, and food came out promptly. Food was tasty and we ate it all.

I liked this place.  We went for breakfast and I had an egg and sausage dish on a roll.  Really didn't like the roll at all, but what was inside was great (didn't need all that bread anyways).  We sat outside and I really want to go back at night with the fireplace going and listen to some music.  I'll be back.

It's hard to review this place because they are all over the place. The layout needs a facelift. So random. Staff always looks stoned or hung over. I guess I blame that on poor management. I want to like the overall idea of the place and I welcome independent restraunts with creativity but this place needs help. I was really grossed out when I saw a server drag his 3' dreads (open kitchen) through some food..

We go sometimes 3 times a week. Put up with the sometimes, not super fast service, it is a great place with no frozen food or microwaves. It's real food! Plus the beer and wine selections are the best. We love this place and the people there. The tukee would suffer without this spot!

Delicious fresh locally sourced food - reminds me of Panera. Super friendly staff. Check out their great happy hour!  Just had a weekly special summer salad with grilled chicken, romaine, apples, orange, grapes, strawberries and pecans with a strawberry dressing. They smoke their own meat. The smoked brisket burrito is a special expiring the end of this week and I will be back to try it!

I've had a bit of a roller coaster ride with this place but I loved the highs so much I kept going back. I'm so glad I did... I had a few questionable take out experiences and once my order hadn't even been started when I showed up 15 minutes after I called?? Everyone just kind of stood around and looked at me confused. Anyway that was about 2 years ago.... Recently everything has been spot on ;) I'm such a huge huge fan of every salad I've had from here. My go to's are the derby and spot chop salad. Also have enjoyed the burgers, veggie sandwich, and pancakes. Food has never let me down and the new management (I think Omar) seems to have turned the place around! Currently loving it....!!

I guess I am not the first one to state that service is awful in this great place. The food is consistent, and the fact that is is a local place, using local product is what made us come back over and over. But today was just a disaster. Waiting for someone to approach your table for 10 minutes, to finally have this waitress whose face loudly shows "I hate my job, I would rather be dead than being here" is a huge turn off. We love this place and went there to see if we could organize a brunch for 20 people; but after today's experience, I would be embarrassed to bring anyone there. I realized after reading other reviews on Yelp that I am far to be the only one complaining about service, and am wondering when changes will occur. There are other local businesses around where I can spend my money. Needless to say, the $1 tip I left today was way too much for the "service" received. Management: retrain your staff, be more selective in the hiring process, and teach them how to put a smile on their face.
Always crowded on Sunday and at lunch time! Good service and their burgers are delish!

Portions could be bigger and coffee is expensive.   Pluses are that the pancakes my dad had are comparable to Matt's Big Breakfast and you don't have to wait for 2 hours for them. The outside seating is adorable and the homestyle fries are good. My mom hit the nail on the head though with this sandwhichy eggy thing with avocado. The bread and everything else about it was delic. I am excited for them to refine their menu a little bit and then this will become an Ahwatukee gem! We need more of them!!!!

Hillside Spot is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are fantastic. I have selected items from all over the menu and have not been disappointed. They use high quality ingredients and source from local vendors, which, for me, is a big selling point.  For breakfast I would recommend the croque madame, farmer's omelette, or if you are looking for something sweet, their pancakes are some of the best I have had.  For lunch/dinner I feel that it is pretty much mandatory to order the guacamole as a starter. Basically all of their salads are great, but the real stand out is the Spot Chop. The meat for their burgers is ground in house and they cut their own fries, so you can't go wrong there. I have also been known to order the vegetable torta a time or two.   They also have a great Mexican food menu, which I have only ordered from once, but that one order happened to be one of the best Carne Asada burritos I have ever tasted.

Went this morning.  Ordered a ham torta sandwich and coffee.  You have to order sides as an extra but the sandwich alone filled me up and I was only able to eat half!! The coffee was great and I mentioned it to our server.  "IT'S CARTEL COFFEE"  well that's WHY!!!!!!!!!!!! omg I love Cartel and so stoked this place is right by our place!  The scene is hipster and service is slow like the servers "just work there, but don't really need the money sort of way".  Still- ill go back- and be patient, because the food is good and the coffee is bomb and its close to my house.

I really enjoy eating at Hillside Spot. The atmosphere is great. It has the perfect mixture of traditional and modern in a laid back setting. Even better, the food here is amazing. It always tastes fresh, flavorful, and ultimately delicious. I am a fan of the burgers, myself, so I highly recommend those. Also, the wait staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, perfecting the dining experience.

Hillside also has great dinner and lunch meals. The mesquite chicken is delicious, they have really good Mexican food, plus great sandwiches and a plethora of interesting salads that are healthy and taste delicious. I love the atmosphere, the wine and beer list, the outdoor seating, the pulled pork sandwich, the fries, there is a lot to like about Hillside. I just wish they would stay open later. 8 p.m. even on a weeknight is too early to close.

This place needs improvements in so many areas! Our experience was very similar to some of the other reviews. We went there for breakfast on a Saturday morning. There was plenty of open tables when we got there, but we were still had to wait 10-15 minutes to get seated. The hostess explained to us that the cooks were 'catching up' on the orders and that's why we had to wait. When I asked if she could just seat us and take our order 10-15 min later, she looked completely confused and said, "uh...I...don't know...I was told not to seat anybody". So there was a bunch of other people just standing there, waiting, and you could see they getting frustrated by this too.  We finally go seated and the waitress got our order, she was nice, but took a long time to come back after she took our drink order. We waited at least 20 minutes to get our food. When the food finally arrived, we were not impressed at all! My husband got the El Jefe Omelet, it looked soooo good on the menu, but he was very disappointed. We paid $8.50 for a below average omelet with 1 slice of toast. They charge extra for sides like home potatoes...most restaurant places we go to include the toast and potatoes with your meal, especially when you pay that much! So yeah, their prices are not the best, especially for the quality and quantity of food. I got the El Gallo Torta, and it was OK. We also paid $3 for 1 egg and a slide of toast for our son, and never got a refill on our coffee. This place has potential, I like their concept, but they need A LOT of improvement if they want to keep customers coming back. I know we won't be back after our disappointing experience.

Normally, I don't like coming here because the service is so slow but I was very happy last night. Madison was our server and she rocked it. We had some salads and desert and couple of beers. Food is always good here but the service is typically slow. If all the servers were like Madison I'd be there all the time.

Food was great- had a Croque Madame. Sat outside, but flies were TERRIBLE! You literally couldn't stop waving your hand or one would land on your face or food. I looked around, they were everywhere, even inside. I realize we're outside but really, something could be done I think- or at least an apology for them.   Bathrooms are okay- no seat covers.   Great art hanging on the wall!
We've been there for breakfast and dinner. Can't argue w/ the good reviews as we haven't experienced anything wrong yet. It's our neighborhood joint so we welcome it w/ open arms.

I come here for the Asado Salad which is one of the better salads out there imo. I'm surprised by how diverse their menu is and eventually I would like to try all of it. Service is always very friendly.

The food is delicious, people watching is superb, the jams are always fresh. Being so close to me I always want to claim it as "My Spot" but there is consistently a problem....The service sucks. They just can't seem to get it right! I always want to give them another try and every time I do, I get let down.  If you don't have a group and are willing to wait a bit with the possibility of your order being messed up, I would suggest Hillside.

Hillside spot is a much needed breath of fresh air in chain-ridden Ahwatukee.  I know there's some local mom and pops in the area but they all seem to be Italian.  Hillside is a top quality fast casual restaurant serving locally sourced and environmentally friendly products.  The service is always really friendly.  I've been coming here since they opened and I've seen them grow over the last few months.  I'm so glad they're here. It's a great place for breakfast, lunch or a quick dinner.  It's fun to sit at the bar and watch the kitchen at work. Their retail area is cute but doesn't offer a wide selection.  This doesn't bother me since I'd rather see more tables than retail space!  They offer a variety of sandwiches, salads, baked goods, and mesquite rotisserie chicken (yum!).  Indoor and outdoor seating is available.

I wanted to like it..... The food is ok. Service was lacking. From the first moment the waiter only bothered to take drink orders from 3 of the 4 of us. Then the food order came; one of the orders was wrong and the response was  "You don't want it?!"  You don't want this meal you did not order? No we wanted what we ordered.   Disappointed is really where I am on this one. Oh and the chop sticks my wife got with her meal was actually just a chop stick, yep just one stick.   Maybe they will upgrade the staff or teach some manners. Either one would be better than where they are now.

This was my first time visiting the Hillside Spot and it was amazing!  The atmosphere is very comfortable and inviting. I built my own breakfast burrito which came with a side of slides bananas, strawberries and blueberries. The roasted salsa that came in the burrito was so good I ordered another side and ate all of it.  I will be back to eat my way through the menu.

I give this place 2 stars because the food is pretty consistent and good, but the service is soooooo bad. Not  just a little bit bad, but a LOT bad. We have been several times and I think we have had one good experience.

Excellent restaurant/cafe in 'Tukee. Great selection of various dishes. I recently went there for breakfast and had the breakfast burrito. It was delicious!! It was a little tangy, but, perfect taste. Great service and atmosphere weather you go there for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Highly recommend!

Wow, good find. Everything we ordered was delicious. They have some amazing bread they get from a local bakery, it's a cross between sourdough and french. You must try this grilled with butter!!! Carne asada sandwiches with avocado-amazing. Mesquite chicken sandwiches, tender-flavorful chicken with the amazing bread. Shrimp and chorizo appetizer-strange but the shrimp tasted so fresh. Guacamole and chips, I've never tasted better-anywhere! You have to visit this place and give them a try!
Food is great, atmosphere is fun and "young". Only thing I hate is the service is always slow...everyone is nice and friendly, but we never come here when we are in a rush...

The food was great.  Everything seemed to be locally sourced and prepared in-house.  We went when during a quiet time of day and so we didn't experience the slow service that other reviewers comment on.  I will definitely go back for a casual meal.

Been here several times, I'm done and am not impressed at the food OR the service( service is usually really bad) and food had varied, however ive had my last bad experience there today. Don't waste your money here.. it's not worth it.

First time there last w/e. Lots of cool looking staff in chef shirts sitting around..only saw two actual people working. Both doing the cooking and prep. The rest of the staff seemed busy palnning and enjoying sitting at the counter while I watched two customers walk in and out without being welcomed..let alone served. If you don't know to go to the counter and order your going to wander around since everybody seems to busy doing who knows what to give EXCELLENT customer service. Look folks, I don't care how good your food or fancy your place is...if you don't meet and greet and provide first class customer service..you ain't gonna be around long. And don't let any other successful restaurants I hear you have mean your a lock at this place. The food was ok...but watching the staff ignore customers is inexcusable. I sure hope you get off your high horses and start welcoming everyone that walks thru the door and ask "is this your first time here" Then give them the drill......trust me, you ain't to big or too important to fail. I'll give this place one more try........you need to warm up the sterile atmosphere....you could learn a lot from Liberty market which seems to be the concept your emulating.

Hillside Spot is spot-on perfection!   First time visiting for brunch this morning & the experience was seamless from start to finish.   Super busy but the wait for a table was not super long.   My nonfat latte was a treat for the eyes & the taste buds! The El Jefe omelet with sourdough toast was a great combo of meat & veggies - not too heavy and perfectly seasoned. My boyfriend raved about his peach green iced tea & banana pancakes.   Our only note is our waitress took quite a while to bring our check at the end of the meal, but she was covering several tables.

I want to love this place!  I hate giving two stars.  Lets start with the pros...  Good coffee Great scones They've done a good job on the environment Staff is friendly  on to the cons...  the review below describes a lunch take out order  Serving staff does not have a snap to it attitude, little to relaxed, stood at counter waiting to order take out for about 5 minutes prior to cashier who waled past me three times even acknowledged me.  Food was mediocre pushing bad.  Ordered the croque monsieur.  How do you screw this one up?  Let me tell you how, the bread was good, sliced too think, and burned around the crust.  The bechamel sauce must have been put on with a fire hose, way to think.  Too top it off the cheese layered on top, was also burned, not lightly golden, black burned.  This sandwich was severally out of balance and tasted poorly.  The chicken was OK.  It had a nice smoky grill flavor.  It was moist.  Here's the rub, the skin was burned,  I like a nice char as much as anyone, however the skin was burned.  The asparagus was very good, had a nice grilled flavor.  The french fries were not good, floppy and not nearly crisp enough.  My overall impression is this place has potential.  Good ambiance, good menu.  Winning comes down to execution and so far i give that a poor rating.  Sorry guys, I do believe in second chances so I will try again.

A classic case of Jekyl & Hyde...the food is great, i've ordered several items off the menu and each one was great.  Ambience is great as well.  Front of the house team is less than stellar.  Wait time at the cash machine is way too long, communication (like get your coffee here, get your water/iced tea there...) was weak, and method of delivering food also chaotic.  i think some strong management would go a long way with that place and i hope it does.  Too many entities have failed in that location and i don't want this to be one.

Ok, I want to love this place, seriously! It's a very cool atmosphere and the food, for breakfast and lunch, is pretty good. Dinner is more like lunch so don't go unless you want a sandwich or something lunch-like for dinner.  The problem with this place is the poor customer service. I have been a regular for a year and a half so you'd think someone would notice me, say hi like they recognize me or do anything to make me feel like they appreciate all my business. Unfortunately, NO!! I honestly feel like a new patron every single time I go here. Never once has anyone said one word to me like "good to see you again" or "how are the kids"...it's a major fail for a local business not to do this really simple thing. So, please, if you read this (and based on their track record, I'm assuming they don't monitor any social networks) can you train your staff to be warm and welcoming to match the decor. While I like this place, I will be coming here much less due to the poor customer service.

This place was great. I ate there for the first time the other day and I was very happy with my breakfast burrito selection. It was not too much food, just right. I was also excited that you can add hash browns to your burrito for $1. The coffee is really great too!

I'm not feeling the love here. Went to Hillside on the recommendation of a friend that lives nearby and loves the place. I would love it more if it was my local caf. We went on a Sunday morning, knew there would be a crowd but the wait in line wasn't long and we had a table right off.  The entire line stopped while the order taker bagged up the to go portion of my order, my friends pie to go ordered at the same time took over an hour to get to the table. What was that? the food is good the portions large. They can't afford to get a number system for the tables? A wait person stood behind the drinks station/bar bellowing my name. not even stepping around. I had to stand up and holler  because I COULD NOT FIND THE PERSON WHO HAD MY FOOD. The food was nice but living in the east valley I wouldn't drive cross town to eat here again.

One star for the quality of food, and one star for the great coffee. If only the service were improved, I would happily offer a 5 star rating. We've been going there infrequently for about 14 months, mostly because I like good coffee. Finally after the fourth bad service experience I've decided to look elsewhere. Two cups of coffee were luke warm by the time they reached us and the slice of cheesecake to share came so much later we had nearly finished our coffee. Two things perplex me. Firstly, there were only 3 other tables with customers at the time (mid-afternoon on a weekday so not exactly buzzing with customers) and secondly, having cleared our own table of previous customer's plates (moved to an adjacent table), the waitress ignored those dirty plates along with others on tables nearby, which was bizzare since she walked past them 4 times. Finally, we had to go looking for the waitress to get the check since she never once checked in with us to see if we had everything we needed. I'm so terribly disappointed.

Food is wonderful but service is not.  I looked at the other reviews and this seems to be the consensus.  NOt sure why they don't try to correct it.  Patio is really nice on cooler nights.  I can't get my husband to go here anymore due to the service but the food is very good.

My husband and I frequent Hillside.  We started off just going for breakfast (great breakfast burritos, by the way!) and then decided to try out their dinners.  Their food is awesome!  I've liked just about everything I've tried, with the exception being the fish tacos, and even those weren't bad, just mediocre.    Our favorites there are the guacamole as an appetizer, the carne asada torta (My husband raves about this one.), the chicken sandwich, and the salads.  Their fries are amazing, especially if you ask for a side of their homemade ranch.  My complaint with Hillside is the service.  On a few occasions, we've gotten waiters that aren't particularly friendly and forget to check in on us to see if we need anything.  And during peak times, they sometimes have dropped the ball and forgotten to bring out appetizers or drinks.  That being said, we look past the occasionally lackluster service and still dine their frequently.  The food keeps us going back.  Oh, and try the chocolate chip cookies!  Also... they have half-price bottles of wine on Wednesdays, ribs on Thursdays and craft beer night is also that night.
Unless they have cleaned up the back patio area, sit inside. Took my kids to eat, sat outside and it smelled terribly of sewage. Tables were dirty, food is ok.
Love Hillside for breakfast. Switched it up for a lunch burger. El Norteno with chorizo, green chile's, tomato, onion on a toasted bun. First time for the fries. A+++++

I want to like this place, but I've been twice and won't go back.  Both times I have had to wait close to 30 minutes for my food.  And the food, while decent, wasn't worth a 30 minutes wait.  Plus, the cost of the food ($8+ for a sandwich) is pretty high considering that it comes with nothing on the side (no pickle, no chips, no fruti, nothing).  It's just not worth the money or the time for me to go back there.

The food at Hillside was good (he had a breakfast burrito and I had pancakes). The pricing and service was fine. We had to wait close to 40 minutes to get seated though. Overall it was a pretty good experience but I wasn't overly impressed.
Great place to go good service nice atmosphere good grub i highly recommend them the grilled cheese is good fresh crispy crunch bread. Love the fire outside on the patio

Food was absolutely amazing! But service isn't great. Barely saw our server and had to get the waters we asked for from the bar because they never came. Currently sitting at our table waiting for her to come back so we can pay it's been about 15 min since we saw her.

Always friendly, great for breakfast & lunch! Outside seating with fire pit or inside seating with lots of options. Extensive beer menu! Wifi option. Dog friendly :-) & bike parking.  We love to come here on a sat or sun afternoon, however be prepared there might be a wait. This is definitely an AZ one of a kind dinning experience...come and check it out for your self :-)

We've had breakfast at Hillside many times and have never left a review until now. I was just reading a few of the reviews people have left. I think some of them must be naturally grumpy people or were having a bad day. I feel kind of bad for them. Well, maybe not really. If they don't want to give it another try that leaves more room for those of us that love this place. We have always found their staff top notch and very helpful. We love their breakfast and have had most everything on the breakfast menu. Love it all.  And an evening on the patio with a glass of wine and good company is all I need.  Love this place.

The valley could use more locally owned places such as this, a relaxing joint to have a bite and no need to feel like in a rush.  I definitely give credit to our table runner... just as I asked where the knife and fork was, he immediately said he'd get it and other staff were unobstrusive about removing our plates later.  Since it's not restaurant style and leave a tip on the table, I think the higher prices are justifiable for their great service and pay their salary.   As for the food, it's ok.. nothing mindblowing.. the bread (MJ's?!) under the croque monsieur was excellent but the rest was meh.. ended up scraping off the bechamel and eating the bread alone.  Tunia fish is fresh and tasty, generous helping.  It's really the combo of the  atmosphere and friendly vibe that would have me come back if I'm in the Ahwahtukee area.
Place is great, great menu, great food, great service, good ambience to boot..

We went for a late breakfast today. A is close to home and I really enjoy the fact that they are locally owned and use local foods. The food was great and I would have given 5 stars but the service was not great. We really enjoyed the "Hit the Spot" pancakes and the El Jeffe omelet.  Will head back and try their Happy Hour for sure.
They have the best breakfast coffeeI have had in years!  I'm actually spoil and all ready have it in my morning routine
Everything here is good! Be prepared to wait a little while for your food, especially if they're busy, because it's prepared made-to-order.  But it's well worth the wait!
I ate breakfast and had a mocha here with soy. One of the absolute best places I've had for a coffee/mocha. In my top two places competing with Lux for the best specialty coffee I've had!

I lived in walking distance of this place for two years and it sat empty. I finally move and a great place opens up...WTH? I am very happy that Ahwatukee is finally getting a few places that are up to my urban girl standards (Hillside Spot and Pomegranate). I was waiting like a kid on Christmas day for this place to open. One Sunday while at the Farmers Market I passed by and it was jammed packed. Not what I was looking for on a quite Sunday morning. I stopped by again during the week and they were closed. Talk about disappointed. I did snag a menu and it looked rather promising.  A few weeks go by and I stop in for lunch. The place is crowded but not crazy crowded. I go up to the counter and order and they give you a little number for your table or they call your name, I can't remember. I grabbed my drink at the self service area. I got a great ice tea. This is coming from a complete tea snob. I waited a few minutes and out came my tuna sandwich. To my surprise the bread was toasted. OK so I am about to go on a bit of a tangent here...TEXTURE, TEXTURE, TEXTURE. I hate tuna sandwiches on soft bread. It feels like a pile of mush in your mouth. Totally yucky in my book. But this sandwich was on toast...YEAH someone got the texture memo. However, the tuna was bland, with a bit more seasoning this could be an awesome sammie.  My next encounter was a few days ago. Just finished hiking South Mtn and decided to stop in with a friend. We were not starving but wanted a little something. I was told for dinner they have table service. OK I am standing at the register like it is lunch time. Maybe they should have a sign up for that. No biggie. The dinner menu was very small. I found myself looking at the lunch menu wishing some of the selections were available for dinner. We decide to split the Derby Salad and french fries. We wait what seems like forever and our fries come out by a runner. She says the salad would be out shortly. Well the salad took forever and a day. We were almost finished with the fries by the time the salad came out.   The kitchen is open so I could hear the cooks having some issues with my salad. It appeared that one of the ingredients was missing (bacon) but they located some and fried it up. It was a nice touch to the salad. But as long as I waited I could have done without it. The fries were fresh cut and just the right amount of seasoning. On my way out I spotted the biggest slice of red velvet cake in the cooler. OMG a little bit of the South started to come out. If you lived in the South you know what I mean. Red velvet cake is one of my favorites. I asked about the price and it was a very inexpensive $4.50. Wow what a steal. But today is not cheat day so I have to wait.   The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is cool.  However, a bit dark inside at night. This place has great potential. A definite need for this neighborhood. I think the menu might have to get tweaked and maybe the kitchen staff could be better prepared. As time goes on I am sure they will work out the kinks. All in all I don't think you would be disappointed.

Went for brunch on the weekend, and I had none of the issues some of the below reviewers experienced.  The egg torta w/ avocado was delicious (including the bread), we got a table very quickly, and our server was professional and always there when I needed a coffee refill or more water.    That, combined with the local ingredients and the layout (tons of windows and light), make it a winner as far as I'm concerned!  Give it a try - I will definitely be going back.

YUM!  My husband and I went on a Sunday morning for a late breakfast. I got Huevos Rancheros Verde and it was fantastic, very flavorful and not overly spicy. I ordered my eggs scrambled and they came fried but that isn't a huge issue for me because they where done properly and not overly oily.  The service was friendly and attentive and my tea got filled without me having to ask. I am looking forward to trying dinner here. The menu looked good and they have a great selection of local beers and you can even take a 6 pack home.  I will get go back here for sure.

This was the first time I have ever eaten in this restaurant.  A friend brought me here and loves the place.   The Service was great.  Friendly, upbeat and fun.   The food was incredible.  I only had a hamburger but it was very fresh (and almost too much to eat).  The fresh veggies and carmelized onions on the burger were yummy.  I was only able to eat about 3 of my homemade fries due to how big the burger was.   The atmosphere was wonderful.  Cozy, yet a combination of business folks and ladies lunching etc.   All in all a great experience.  I will definate recommend in the future.

Went there for breakfast and I had the huevos rancheros. That came with a little side of fruits. The food was good and the ambiance at 7am was very quiet and pleasant. I loved the coffee there which was refilled generously throughout breakfast. It's probably one of my favorite places in Ahwatukee.

Too bad as I think the food and atmosphere is good, but twice now I got food posioning from this place.  I just can't risk going here anymore.   The last health inspection had 6 violations.   I've never got food posioning in Mexico but now 2 times from this place.....Eat at your own risk.

While visiting AZ, we (husband & I) are typically on the look out for a good breakfast place. I found this place, so I was kind of excited to try it. We went on a Saturday morning around 9ish. The wait was not bad ~ 15 min. The coffee was lukewarm, not worth drinking. The food was okay - I kept thinking, "This would be really good with . . ." (an additional ingredient). Service was mediocre.   The vibe I got - this restaurant is for you if you want local, fresh, maybe organic, but flavor isn't as important.

this spot is amazing. came here to have breakfast with my dad while i was in town last week and it was so good we came back the very next day and order the same thing. the service was great and the atmosphere was laid back. i ordered the huevos rancheros and a cafe latte with whip cream and my dad ordered the croque madame. the very next day we both ordered the croque madame and it was just as delicious as the day before. the service the next day was just as great as the first day. i am always looking for a good breakfast spot whenever i visit AZ which is often. i also look for one to recommend to friends that recently moved to AZ and have this spot in mind to share.

Tried again bc it's kinda dog friendly. We called said one seat left for dogs, reserved it, wasn't available when we got in. Ok no biggie, after waiting they brought out another table. Didn't have mimosas, then next 2 wines we asked for. Brought my guy wrong omelet w no apologies. Fruit bowl was only strawberries, should call it strawberry bowl. They did bring a bowl out for our dog, but had to use our water to fill. Never ever again.
People waiting everywhere, pregnant lady and all. 6 empty tables outside 4 inside! If you can't take care of your customer it doesn't matter how good your food is! Checked in and out.

Having lived in Ahwatukee for 15 + years,  I have enjoyed Hillside Spot on several occasions.  I love the "local" vibe and great food.  What I didn't like on my last two visits (lunch last week and breakfast this morning)  is the feeling of dirtyness all around me.    I watched someone grab a rag from a square bucket sitting on the ground,  ring it out,  wipe down a table and then drop the rag back into the bucket (half in and half out with part of the rag touching the floor) repeat this same process throughout our meal.  (see photo). The fans are very dirty,  bathrooms are very dirty.  These are the areas that we as customers can see... Makes you wonder what we don't see.    The age and vintage feel of the restaurant is great.  Love that it's a part of the history of Ahwatukee,  but it doesn't have to be dirty.  It doesn't cost anything to clean...   I really enjoy this restaurant and would love to come back,  but not sure if I will until I know they change the cleanliness.

food is OK ambiance is nice portions were kinda small... SLOW service!! I asked for an extra side of tortillas.... it took forever it was brought over to me after I was way done with my food... we wanted to order more food but we didn't want to wait ... will not be coming back

I have been here alone, with family (child included), friends, and with my significant other alone. Coming from someone who has been here various times throughout the day I can say that typically the quality of food is fresh and tasteful, but about two months ago we stopped in around 11 A.M. only to encounter a horrible experience. The food was stale and tasteless. The servers stood around appearing to laugh sarcatiaclly while water glasses at several tables stayed empty and coffee cups continued to lack refills.    A Few weeks later we returned. The food and service were better but there are some staff and one manager that clearly don't enjoy their jobs (turn off). This place is usually good but when it's bad-it is really bad.  Wifi-the consistently reliable wifi is reason enough to come here and give it an extra star.

My family and I just found this spot. It's a local place so we decided to give it a try. We have been there 3 times with today being our latest venture. We absolutely love the food but the employees just bring this place down. I sat at watched the food runner mope around looking half asleep and hating his job. He kicked the door open every time he went to the patio. His shoe prints were all over the door. He came inside once and pulled the door open so hard it actually hit the customer on the outside. He was taking food to the patio and he cut off some customers who were being seated. When he brought our food he asked if we needed anything else and my husband asked for more Splenda and he was CLEARLY annoyed with that request (he brought 2 packets). I cant believe this place is ok with this kind of "customer service". All three times we have been here we have had terrible waiters. The upside to today's meal was the girl who took our plates when we were finished. Very nice girl and did more for us than our own waitress. I'm all for supporting local businesses but you need to earn my business. Just because you are local to me doesn't mean I won't cross the freeway to Crackers where I can get better customer service. We decided today we will give it one more chance then we're done. I hope it doesn't dissapoint.

I use to love coming here but this will be the last time. 3 stars for the food and 0 stars for the service. The manager seems like he has no idea what he's doing and the waitress we got was rude as hell. She didn't even apologize when we told her we been waiting an hour for our food. She then comes back with the manager saying they lost our ticket. The lemonade was so sour I think the waitress was playing a joke because she seemed super racist. She didn't smile once wish I would got her name. My friends and I will never come here again.

We came across this place one morning as we needed some coffee to start our day.  I was pleasantly surprised that it was a  restaurant as well.  They were preparing the bbq pork for lunch and boy did that smell good!  We decided that this is a place we must visit again when we had more time.  So the following weekend, we return and order pancakes with fruit compote (apples) an spinach omelette and coffee. We received our omelette right away, but had to wait at least 30 minutes for syrup because they ran out.  Because we had to wait so long, they brought us a fresh order of pancakes once they got more syrup.    Hmmmm...I don't know about you but if you serve pancakes, shouldn't you always have syrup??  Oh well it was still delicious.  But that did not keep us away as they gave us a card for 2 free breakast or lunch for the inconvenience so we returned.    We went back for lunch this time and we both ordered the pork sandwiches....OH YUMMY! Mmmmm-Good! I must return for another one of those!  Did I mention the coffee is delicious?!  I would give at least four stars for this rating, but we were wanting pancakes with our omelette and running out of syrup is just not cool.

Okay..so I have been to this place at least 5 times and I keep thinking that the service will get better...well..that never happened, but as dumb as I am I decided to give it another try for lunch today...FAIL...it was..plainly put...horrible!!  The food got worse than it was before and as there was not a whole lot of people there at 3pm for lunch, I was surprised by this and the fact that it took almost 35 minutes to get our food.  Five times of coming here has added up to mediocre food, cold food, and to be quite honest shitty crappy slow service!  Don't know what it is because they have a good menu and location, but maybe they need to find people to work there who take great pride in service and food quality.  My carne asada torta tasted like ten day old meat that was scraped off of the ground in the back during the morning breakfast rush!  Anyhow...five times is enough..I won't be coming back as I know that I have given it enough chances to become a regular spot of my dining experience!

My co-worker and I accidentally stumbled upon Hillside Spot this morning and I'm happy that we did. Initially, we were drawn in because we were looking for a good Latte/Espresso but when we smelled the food we had to take a seat and order breakfast. I started off with a Caramel Latte with an extra shot of espresso; it was perfectly balanced no bitterness at all. There was a nice foam on the top and little caramel left on the bottom when I was finished, YUM! For my entre I had the El Jeffe Omelet which had fresh tomatoes, spinach and chorizo. It was pretty tasty (wish it was served with some sort of salsa), I also had the "country potatoes" which were really seasoned hash browns. The hash browns were a little salty for my taste but I mitigated the salinity with some ketchup and it was just fine. The atmosphere has a relaxed modern feel. I can definitely see myself going back here again. The service was a little slow since there was only two servers but I'm understanding.
Just tried this quaint little restaurant.... LOVE love LOVE IT !!!!  We will definitely be back !!! Food was AMAZING .... An I just love supporting local small business !

As always, my wife and I are always looking for new places to eat.  We wanted to eat breakfast and decided on one place.  We soon realized that we needed to start out our shopping on the other side of town so we did another search for breakfast and found this place.  What a great find.  We were seated right away and our server came to us within just a few minutes.  I must say that their coffee was awesome.  It didn't taste like that chain restaurant coffee that everyone is use to.  The inside is very eclectic.  A lot of different things going on but very cool.  The one thing that I thought was so cool and that I love, is the open kitchen.  I don't know why but I really like to watch people in a kitchen cook.  The bar had those old time stools that reminded me of the stools in my science class in high school.  My wife had something called....well I can't pronounce it and sure as hell cant remember how to spell it so let me describe it.  It was a thick piece of Levain bread with ham, cheese and an egg.  Very simple and very delicious.  I did the BYO omelet (chorizo, turkey, gruyere, spinach and jalapenos were my choices) and it was delicious.  This is a spot that we will definitely try to come back to.  See you guys next time.

like a lot of other yelpers and my most recent dining companion, i really want to like this place. really, i do. they're doing something right! sourcing locally, using organic, whole ingredients...but more often than not they just don't click.  i've eaten here about five times now. twice for dinner, a couple of breakfasts and once for lunch. breakfast seems to be a slam dunk. it's pretty basic though chaotic on weekend mornings. pancakes are scrumptions. but it's true, there are an ungodly amount of flies in the place! lunch was ok. but on my most recent dinner trip, what i had was just blah. i ordered the chopped salad which could be so fantastic. hearty, leafy greens, cabbage, yulu seeds and other things make it sound like a healthy dish. but when it came out covered in a thick, creamy, tasteless ranch-style dressing, it was anything but. i could have overlooked the healthy factor if it tasted good, but the dressing was so bland there was just nothing to like about it.  i'll probably keep coming back here because, like i said, i desperately want to like it. though it will likely be only for breakfast.

Another year another review.  I've been going here for over two years now and it's still one of my favorite breakfast spots in Ahwatukee.  The restaurant has changed things up from time to time for the better and they always have great food.  The staff is always cheerful in the morning and they make a great mocha.  The also get bonus points for having an actual "large" mocha.  It's been awhile since I ate lunch or dinner here, but I'll have to scoot by for happy hour and update this review.  The breakfast menu has been updated to add a few new things and keep the old favorites.  I highly recommend the Huevos Rancheros Verde it's my usual go to breakfast and the best I have found so far anywhere in Phoenix.  The verde sauce is great ( not really spicy though ) and the Oaxaca cheese filled tortilla is delicious. If you aren't in the mood for eggs the "Hit the Spot" pancakes are a huge portion and really good.  Order the hash browns crispy though as they tend to be on the limp side if you don't. They have plenty of tables, a counter, and an outside patio for dining.   Try: - Huevos Rancheros Verde - Mocha - "Hit the Spot" Pancakes - Croque Madame
Horrible service followed very expensive bland food, these guys were once a great place but got a little full of themselves and down hill they go..

Most of the food here is decent.  I found a couple things I really like and stick to those.  And those couple dishes are really good.  The service here is so inconsistent though.
