Sometimes it's excellent, sometimes it's just OK, and sometimes you will get seated and wait 15 minutes to even get a water.  Maybe an exaggeration, but it can really be that inconsistent.  I've been there at least a dozen times.  I'll probably go back again, but just because it is really close and affordable.  They could do better though.

I used to like this place but I don't think I'll be coming back. It's just not worth the price. Also asked for breakfast at 2 minutes after 4pm. Had the place been crowded I could have understood, but they were dead. Won't be back anytime soon.

Usually the food can redeem a restaurant. Not this time. The pancakes were good, but not fluffy. When other yelpers say the service is bad, they're not lying.   When we first came in, they said a 20 minute wait, which is fine on a Sunday morning. That was not an issue. There is a "market" when you first come in, I ordered an iced coffee, it took about 10 minutes to get that. Now, I can be reasonable and say that that cashier was a server and was clearing out other guests bills. But come on, if your a "market" have someone manning the register and making the items your are offering.   Once we finally got seated, the server was very attentive. He got our drinks and let us discuss our what were going to order within our party. When he returned, he wrote everything down and I am assuming he entered the ticket. But he did not return to get us a refill for about 10 - 15 minutes. About 5 - 10 minutes later, someone in my party had to ask the server when we would expect our food (after we had already waited twenty minutes), he said "less than two minutes." It a came about five minutes later.   I ate chilsques verdes, and at least I can be some what certain that the chicken was not from a can. I got a piece of bone in one bite and in another bite I got chicken cartilage from a drum stick.   I believe if they continue to have this bad service, it will eventually bite them I'm the butt.   The real reason I am giving them two stars instead if one, is because the atmosphere is very nice. The experience was way too bad for me to want to give this place after chance. Nor is the food redeeming enough. And also, for the amount of food you get, this really should be a $$$ restraunt.

We went back for another visit just a couple of weeks ago, hoping things had gotten better.  Nope.  We wanted to sit outside, near the fire.  You'd think we asked the hostess if we could sit on the roof.  Obviously, we pissed her off just by daring to come in.  Service was slow - and it wasn't even that busy!  And for the love of Pete, could you do something about your staff yelling out orders and such?    Sorry, as much as I like supporting local businesses, we won't be back.
Love this spot. Food is great and the staff is friendly. Good music and they even have Finn River Cider. Breakfast all day!

Gotta come here for the carne asada tortas, is what I was told.  While I liked the bread, the carne asada on the other hand was dry and overcooked.  It would have been great if it were juicier and more flavorful.  Otherwise the overall sandwich was alright, nothing which stands out.

Overpriced and underwhelmed. Dropped in to grab a to-go order at 7:30pm on a Tuesday and almost turned around before entering because I thought it was closed. No hostess was visible and the place looked completely empty. It was open though with a sign to seat yourself. Servers seemed to just roam and help anyone who asked for something. The atmosphere could be really cute, but the lack of friendliness and customers made it feel very awkward and quiet.  After all was said and done, our $20 rib eye with a side of stir fry bell peppers and side salad (which literally was just a bowl of wilted arugula - not even a crouton), $15 shrimp and veggie pasta (which was penne pasta with what looked like the same stir fry mix in an oily/butter sauce) and two $6.50 glasses of subpar wine was definitely not worth it. And to top it off, a server set down the to-go food and walked off. I had to ask another server if they wanted me to pay the bill before I left.  I expect far more from a restaurant's atmosphere, customer service and food quality for $52.13.

The restaurant has a great vibe which is hard to find.  I went there with three friends for a late breakfast and we were seated quickly.  However that is all that happened quickly.  Although it was not crowded it took 45 minutes to be served and another 45 to get our checks.  We had questions about our bills and it took another 15 minutes before we saw our server again.  Everyone's meal was iffy. I had an omelet which was so overcooked that I had to put salsa on it to moisten it up.  I asked for two substitutions and was charged for added ingredients, $1.50 for avocado and onion instead of chorizo and red peppers. The server should have told me there would an additional charge even if it was a substitution. The huevos rancheros looked just as overcooked and dry.  Don't think I will return because of so many disappointing issues with service, food quality, and charges. They had very few options for a gluten free meal so I don't think it would be possible to avoid "substitution" surcharges. Their prices would be fine if the quality were better.

Awesome!!! OMG I had the croque madame with a poached egg on top! It was so authentic and delicious! Heavenly will go back anytime I am in need of breakfast/lunch in Ahwatukee!!!! Wish they were in Scottsdale! Open one in Scottsdale so I can go every week!

Service was good and madam croquet was really good!!! Definitely have to try. Ordered 3 and my kids and my husband and me loved it. They don't have French toast ... But everything is fresh. Freshly squeezed orange juice ...

So I've been here a few more times in smaller groups and during less crowded times. My new favorite is the Levain & Lox... it's so very yummy.  I still think it's uber trendy and that's not drawing to me but i honestly enjoy the food and even the staff at the bar (i prefer there lately)is nice and attentive. .it's kind of hipster at times but I've grown to just accept that and still enjoy my food and yummy coffee.

What was once a wonderful establishment where you could come and hangout with your friends and enjoy fine dining (breakfast, brunch and lunch too) is now something tasteless. I mean that quite literally. I use to come here several times a week because my friends were working here and we all lived nearby so we'd spend a lot of time eating up the menu. I notice their corns are still a hit! But upon moving back recently from college, I wanted to give it a try since it been a few years. The reason I am not giving this place 1 star is because our waitress was very sweet. I can't remember her name but she was a pretty blonde girl with glasses, we adored her! She was so prompt, kind, and had a great personality.   Now for the food. I have always ordered the carne asada sandwich. I ordered it recently and there was absolutely no flavor. What once use to be a delicious carne asada that had this flavorful marination and sauce that would drip as you took a bite is now a very dry, disgusting, plain, no-good sandwich. I mean really? I am paying a little over $9 for a sandwich that has dried up steak meat with avocado thrown on top? and french fries that were plain and dry. No thanks.   My boyfriend ordered a chicken sandwich with corn on the side. His chicken was not only over-cooked and super dry, I am pretty sure there was NO sauce in his sandwich either. It had no flavor, we were using the tobasco and chalula sauce like crazy. This isn't the Hillside Spot I remember.   The only good thing? The coffee was great, the corn was awesome, and our waitress was a sweetheart.

Had high hopes for this place. Tried it twice and both experiences were a fail. First time the omelette were burned. Second time, nobody even acknowledged we were in the cafe. We sat and sat, and sat. Staff were chit chatting with each other and never looked our way. Finally we got up and walked out. Nobody cared because nobody said a word to us.
I like this place but it's over priced!!! The waittress should have realized that there were other ways to price out grilled chicken and salad than to charge me $20 for French fries I didn't want!
Always a good place with a hip vibe.  Healthy, yummy and fun.  Something for everyone and a good mix of people.  Great outdoor patio seating area as well.

This place is circling the drain.  I don't get it... The location is great with little competition nearby but when we went there today they were so slow and the food was so poorly cooked that we won't be going back and will drive 10 minutes more to go somewhere else.  The place has a lot of potential, good menu and ambiance, but the execution is poor.  I hope they go out of business soon so someone can open up something better at that location.

I love this place, accept for their black coffee. I've had the smoked ribs, hamburgers, breakfast burritos, etc. and I loved them all. Service is great as well. We take our out of town visitors there. The coffee during breakfast though is too watered down so get your coffee before or after your visit.

We had an extremely long wait for 6 on a sunday morning around 10. Not much they can do about that though. When we finally did eat I had the chilaquiles. The food was good, but didnt even come close to filling me up. It was fresh and had good flavor. I just wish that for the price i would have gotten a bit more. I also ordered a side of sour cream ($0.50 for a large spoonful). When I reminded them about the sour cream the server left and then came back empty handed. He then took the side of sour cream from my friends plate (breakfast burrito) and gave it to me saying it was supposed to be mine. Really? Why not just leave his on his plate which he may have already touched and bring me a new one? Especially since it was your fault in the first place. A little odd if you ask me.

Ok.. maybe it's me.  Maybe I just bring bad luck and trouble with me when I go here....I don't know...it's so confusing..  I keep going back every month or so because I really want to like the place and make it part of my routine.. it's in my 'tukee neighborhood, the food is really good when it's done right and it's an interesting building and setup.  I repeat, I want to like this place.  A lot.    So I took my brother from San Diego who's in town there for breakfast this morning around 9:15AM or so.  Knew we were in trouble with a line to the door  and only one cash register working at the counter.  It took about 15 minutes to get to the counter and there were another 20 people behind us.  (Popularity and poor customer service practices are not giving this place sufficient time and space to clean up their act.)  We ordered, got our number and he sat and I went to the coffee counter to get my Americano.  While waiting on my Americano at the counter I ask the young man 'what's up with this line and a 15 minutes wait to order?'  His response was 'it's because we're so popular everyone wants to eat here'.  Say what? So that justifies a 15+ minute standing wait to order?  I suggested he go  to US Egg in Tempe to really see how a popular and very successful breakfast lunch place delivers excellent customer service.  He made some snide aside to his counter mate, I got my Americano and sat down.  To wait. Dread set in once again.  Bro and I waited 15-18 minutes for our food.  They were out of tableware when I got up to go get some so someone brought us some from the back, including a nice plastic fork. Classy eh.    Breakfast was good.  Oatmeal, eggs, toast.. A couple of proteins with this eggs for Bro.. All done well.  They do get their food right most of the time here.  It's the service level that since day one has been and still can be very iffy.  I get they had one out of two counter cash registers broken.. And that's not my problem as a customer.  What's their back up plan?  Or it is to make people just stand and wait?    We ate, talked.. and waved at flies.  This place has more flies in it than any restaurant I've ever eaten at in this country.  I saw several folks at tables next to us also doing the Hillspot fly wave. It's been that way since opening. I still don't know why.  The really need to get on top of this.  Now.  Flies. Food. Bad.  My bro, instead of leaving as a raving fan of the place, left, like me, shaking his head.  This place really really needs a customer service excellence intervention.  And soon.

Stopped in for lunch today.  I enjoyed the El Norteno burger.  Great chorizo.  The food was four stars while the service was relaxed.   Do not stop here for lunch if you have an hour to return to the office.  Great beer selection which since I was returning to the office I did not sample.

I love that the Hillside Spot is in my neighborhood because we need more places like this, but I think they are just now working through the problems of opening a new place in a "cool-restaurant" starved area.  My first visit was a little weird.  It was crowded and there was no clear understanding of how it worked (no table service at breakfast).  We had just hiked S. Mtn and it was pouring rain.  The line was out the door.  People were pissy and rushed - even the diners.  The room was cold, but you could tell the open architecture would awesome if it wasn't so loud, cold and frantic that morning.  Normally I don't mind the loud, fast more urban breakfast atmosphere but people were fighting over tables and the food deliverers were hard to track down.  Anyway, my farmer's omlette was grossly greasy (egg whites with awesome local veggies lying in a puddle of oil) and the toast wasn't really toast but rather a grease-smeared thin slice of bread thrown on the grill.  I heard from people next to us that I should have had the pancakes or even the bacon & egg scone.   Next time...  I decided to give them another chance the next week when I took a group of friends there for dinner.  WE LOVED IT.  The pace was slower.  Our waiter was helpful and sweet.  We were in high spirits with our glasses of wine and girl talk.  The hamburgers, french fries, rotisserie chicken, salads were all fantastic.  I will definately go again.  I'm already craving the hamburger and that's really not my style.  Must be good.

The Hillside Spot has so much potential, but management or owners are letting service fall through the cracks.   The hipster staff could be excellent, but they need much better management. An employee told us that it was "seat yourself" so the three of us found a table in the center of the restaurant. We sat there for 20-30 minutes and no one stopped by our table. We finally had to flag a random server down.  They really shouldn't have a "seat yourself" policy if they can't keep an eye on things.  We met here because Hillside is one of the few places open early.  The chilaquiles were nice and crunchy. The green chili flavor was great. The croque madam was also well made. The bacon was pretty basic. The hashbrowns were only slightly crispy, but I'm glad they were overly greasy. I love the look and design of the restaurant. The bar is cute. The selection of local and craft beers is awesome.   This could be an excellent restaurant, but they need to re-train everyone.

Terrible! I always want to give this place a chance but obviously I need to move on.  The service is probably the worst I have ever experienced and this time the food was just as bad. I think whoever owns or operates this place didn't realize that getting in to the restaurant biz means getting in to the customer service biz. I will never ever go back unless I hear there is new management. Bummer cuz it's a cool spot.
Great food. Service consistently blows. Sit at the bar and you will be fine.
This is a good local and healthy meal at a reasonable price.  Beer and wine selection is a plus. Menu could use a little updating but maybe we eat there too much.

We came here with a group of our friends for Sunday brunch. Upon checking in with the hostess we were told the wait will be 25 min.  after 45 min we asked how much longer we had to wait. The hostess said "we are working on it!"I reminded her how long we have been waiting and she told me she's going to get a manager. The manager Omar told me he can have us seated at 2 separate tables but that we couldn't put them together (no given explanation as to why when I asked, he simply ignored us) that's when we decided to leave. I still couldn't figure out why we didn't get our table but as we were leaving I overheard the hostess talking. Omar the manager told them to not put tables together for large parties but to seat as many 2-4 tops as possible because they were easier and faster! The WORST customer service I've experienced in a restaurant and I've been in the industry of fine dining for 10 years. Get a new manager and retrain your staff never coming here again

We have been trying to give these guys chance after chance for years! No More! Tonight was the last straw. Every single time we have tried to eat here, there has been some issue from the food to the service. It's Saturday night at 7:00 pm and they have about 12 tables. Nello's across the parking lot is mobbed with patrons waiting outside. Umm, what's wrong with this picture?  Tonight, we came in and were seated right away but it took awhile for our server to get to us. She came and took our drink order then left again. She came back with the drinks and took our order. We ordered the Grazing Platter with 3 items. We were pretty disappointed with the quality of the meats and cheeses on the platter.  Our food came and the server dumped our plates down and didn't even bother to pick up the dishes and so forth from our appetizer. Then my husband looked at his Croque Madame. His over easy egg looked like rubber and was so overcooked it the yoke was solid. The sandwich was charred on the edges and pretty much inedible. We tried for 15 minutes to get someone's attention, including calling out "excuse me" and we were ignored. When we finally got her attention and my husband let her have it, he didn't ask her to take the food away because he was starving and had decided to make due. She took the food without asking, my husband having said he didn't want anything else. She left him with a tiny cup of berries. He refused to take half of my burger until I said I was full. Which I did on purpose so he had something to eat.   We saw her go talk to the manager, who incidentally was expediting and the one who let the food go out in the first place,  and heaven knows what was said, but he obviously didn't want to be bothered.   She finally came back - 10 minutes minutes later - and we asked for the check. She got no tip and a note on the bottom of the receipt.

Mediocre service and food.  They sat us at a table right by a door with people constantly coming and going even though there were plenty of tables available.  The coffee was barely lukewarm.  Ia sled for another one and got the same thing.  the bacon was fatty and cheap.  The food was also lukewarm at best.  I didn't see the waitress except for ordering and bringing the check.  I could have gone to Denny's and had a better experience.

Great for breakfast only IMO. Sandwiches like a Ruben made with turkey is Not a Ruben. Oh they have burgers but no roast beef, corned beef or pastrami . Ate there today , my friend & I paid 24$ for uneaten food . Change your big menu, lose most Mexican redundant on your never ending menu& simple it up deli sandwiches...salads...burgers..pastries ..good, no Great sides and your lunch hours won't be so very empty!

Delicious burger!  They have a massive menu with something for everyone.  My gf got a light basil-pesto chicken with a nicely sweet bread, while I got a southwestern burger and fruit on the side.  This is a gem in ahwatukee.  Walking in, I felt at home because it reminded me of many cafes from Boston; it was clean but with a bit of hip grunge look.  There's a big garage door on the one side of the restaurant that opens out for a large patio in the cooler months.  I'll definitely return here when I make trips to ahwatukee.

Came in on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and because it was my first time going I wasn't sure what I was planning to eat yet. The waitress who helped me was very energetic, smiling and was nice enough to answer all my questions about the menu. She suggested I try out their watermelon mimosa and it was definitely really good. Overall my experience was good there until it was time to pay. After she brought out my check and I handed her my card she brought back my receipt and after I was finished I had definitely left satisfied and happy that I had found a new place near me to come and hang out. Now the downside was later that day as I was getting home I realized I couldn't find the card I had used to pay with and so I decided to call them so they could check to see if by any chance I had left it there since I clearly remember she never brought it back. Now this is when my experience changed. As I call in a girl answered and I let her know I had been eating there earlier and that there was a possibility my card was never returned. She then tells me that she will transfer me to a manager and let me tell you this guy had the worst customer service and annoying voice to top it off. So as soon as I got transferred he doesn't even introduce himself or even asks me what he can help me with instead he asked for my name and the color of my card. After I give him the info he tries to say my name and has a hard time pronouncing my last name so then proceeds to say "yea whatever it is". At this point I'm getting upset so I tell him I'll be heading over since I thought it was strange they had kept it. As soon as I arrive some guy yelled over at me and asked if I was going to order something and after I told him what I was there for he says "Oh right!" In a rude tone and walks away. I'm then left standing there waiting for my card so I asked another guy who was heading to the cash register and before I could finish my sentence he hands me the card with a fake smile and just says "YEAH" in a high pitch sarcastic tone even after the fact that I'm still nice enough to say thank you. One thing I did find strange was the fact that I noticed there were other cards in the register besides just mine. It made me think if maybe I wasn't the only one that this had happened to and that's why the manager had asked for my name and card color. Either way though the way they handled this was very rude.   From all the places I've been to I've never had someone keep my card and to top it off act so rude and unprofessional. I understand accidents happen and she could've forgot to return it but they could've handled this more professionally and maybe even apologized for having to make me go back to pick up MY CARD that they shouldn't have kept in the first place. Because of their unprofessionalism I have unfortunately decided not to return especially knowing how the manager running the place handles things.

I really like this place.  It's got a nice atmosphere, good service and good food.  My husband and I both had salads- the Asado and Venetian with shrimp which were both delicious.  My daughter enjoyed the sweet crepes.  They serve breakfast food all the time and in a previous visit I had one of the breakfast burritos which was also good.  Highly recommend!
Friendly service, pulled pork sandwich was average and the coffee was bland. Would probably not recommend the food we ordered.

There are so many reasons to avoid this place, but I'll be short.  Go to Nellos, it will save you the hassle.  1. Poor service - the first time to contact was around 10 to 15 minutes. There were no apologies. The server noticed us after we started making forts out of menus. 2.  Two servers noticed us, but went on their merry way. 3. Inaccurate beer list - I get excited about beer. They didn't have 3 beers on their menu. The server didn't know what they had in stock. 4. Overpriced beer - $9 for beer you can get for $6 at Bevmo. 5. Flies - holy Pete Sampras, a crap load of flies. We had to eat fast just so the flies wouldn't get our food.  We went to Dairy Queen across the street to make up for the horribleness.

Long story short we came from Los Angeles to a wedding in AZ, before we left I wanted to try this place. The food was okay, the waitress was terrible. She didn't come to our table until it was time to pay, we asked for the check and she was no where to be found so we walked to front register and paid. We were driving back home so I ran back on to use the bathroom, Before I walked out she appeared in front of me and said "was something wrong?" And I was so confused and I said "I'm sorry, I don't think I understand" and she said I front of bunch of customers "you didn't leave me a tip!, where my tip".. OMG I couldn't not believe her I have worked as a waitress before so I couldn't not believe that just happened to me. I was so embarrassed and I looked at her and I just walked away and she still yelled "hey!" As I left.. Never again will I go back there and I hope she learns some manners. I always tile for good service how was I suppose to tip a person that was completely MIA.

We went for breakfast.  The hubby had the pancakes as recommended- I must say D-lish! even without any butter or toppings.  I try to stay away from carbs, but I had to keep sneaking bites from the Mr's plate.   They have a cool patio to eat outside- the weather was perfect!

I love this quaint restaurant! I have so much fun eating here because the choices on their menu are unique, yet familiar. I adores my tuna salad sandwich and my daughter loved her classic pb&j. Our server, David, was very friendly and accommodating, and out my daughters order in first so she could eat faster!

I've been to Hillside Spot around a dozen times and have not had a negative experience other than for some reason I can't remember the name...  "Is it Hillspot Side Diner...no...hm".   I would not survive if it were not for google and a phone that is smarter than me.  Anyway, I love the place. They seem to try to carry as much local items as possible. I was delighted to find out that they serve Cartel Coffee, which is seriously the best coffee you will get in the area. Like many reviews have noted, the bread is fantastic. I particularly enjoy the Croque Madame. Ugh..I'm salivating like a Pavlovian dog just thinking about it.  I like to go with a book and read by the fireplace outside in the few weeks in the valley that it's temperate to do such a thing. The ambiance of the place is hip and comfortable.  Great service and staff. I can't recommend this place enough.

I have been here many times for lunch and it is pretty awesome. The star reduction is for lackluster/slow service at times, very cramped Indoor seating and the two times I came with my baby to meet friends and their two highchairs were in use (they have since purchased more). I almost always get the pulled pork (which has a yummy slaw and apple slices on it), the grown up grilled cheese or street corn. The salads are great as well. They are all about local and organic products/produce and there is a bohemian easy-going vibe there. The juices and lemonades are fresh-squeezed. The outdoor seating area is great! They also sell local brews and homemade baked goods.

Went for lunch one beautiful day.  Food was pretty good, if you like your tuna sandwich with 1-inch chucks of solid tuna.  Great location.  Nice patio, if they can do something about the blackbirds and flies.  Coffee-counter was nice, but the person at the register was very impersonal, almost off-putting.  They should consider having someone else at the ordering station/cashier.  I will try for a 3rd visit, but if it does not improve, I will stick with Nello's, next door.  Good luck!

This place is overpriced and has mediocre food. We asked for separate checks when we entered and after we ate they told us we couldn't have separate checks. I tried to talk to the manager, but he just walked away. This used to be a great place, but when they went to full service , raised prices and took some of their best items off the menu ,it became just another overpriced restaurant that couldn't care less about customer service.

5 stars for ambience 3 stars for food  Okay, let's get one thing straight, it's NOT the best place for breakfast in Ahwautukee or the East Valley; I don't know what is, but I do know Crackers on Elliot and Hardy offers better food. The appeal of this place comes down to it's ambience. It has a very urban feel and reminds one of the breakfast places in San Francisco or any large cosmopolitan city. Everything from the black chalkboard menu to the funky sodas to the Emo/Snow Boarder waiters who yell your name out. Think La Grande Orange in the East Valley! You order at the register and they bring your food to you. You get your own silverware and sauces.  It was also suprisingly quick.   The pancakes came with peanuts, caramel syrup and whipped cream. Honestly, it would have been better with nothing on it. The toppings did nothing for it aside from making it too sweet. The pancakes themselves were what sold me on it as they actually had flavor instead of being like your typical IHOP or McDonalds pancake that is flavorless until you drown it in syrup. The Turkey sandwhich was good but largely because of its bread, other than that, there was really nothing special about it either. I feel like even Teakwoods, the sports bar on Ray and Kyrene has sandwhiches that are more unique like its BLT with a fried tomato.  We had the pancakes and the turkey sandwhich. Both were excellent but both also had something missing. I would probably come back here for the combination of the ambience and the food as opposed to the food itself. I wasn't blown away by the food but the place was a lot of fun because it's unique. We certainly need to support more places like this if we want more non-chains.  The bottomline is it's worth going to because it's fun and it's a great place to take people. Nonetheless, it's clear people have allowed the ambience and vibe to affect it's opinion of the food. The food is good but not noteworthy

Had dinner on a Wednesday night and it was wonderful. Found a great parking spot, was sat on the patio immediately, and we both enjoyed the food. I had the pulled pork sandwich and my hubby got a burger. Grabbed a piece of carrot cake to go on our way out. We will definitely be back!

Took a friend here for breakfast. She had the chilaquiles and I had an omelette. It was absolutely delicious. The crispy bacon, diced tomatoes, and cheddar cheese in my omelette were totally yummy. My friend's chilaquile was really crispy, covered in green sauce and a fried egg. I only gave it 4 stars because I went back a few days later and the food was less stellar.  But still good. I will try to go back during lunch.  The burger looked amazing!

First off, let's talk about what I really enjoy about this spot. I love love their setup: open kitchen and bar, cute outdoor patio with hanging string lights, pet-friendly, a decent amount of baked goods, craft beer and wine bottles up front. I also like the suki's bowl on their menu - very well-thought and flavor-focused combination of ingredients. They also have friendly and attentive staff.   Despite the fact that this location has so much potential, I think they can do better with the menu. First time here, I ordered a bowl of clam chowder on their special of the day menu since I wasn't really hungry. It was average from the presentation to the taste. Second time around, I settled for an order of croque madame topped with over medium egg, side order of fresh melons and extra crispy hash browns. I also got an iced toddy.  It was nice of the server to leave me (a little bit too much) room and a side of classic syrup so I can customize my toddy. The food took a while to come out yet everything was at room temperature when they got to my table. Although the egg was cooked perfectly, my extra crispy hash browns was mostly soft and soggy :(. Croque madame was also average. Considering it was my first time trying croque madame, I can't tell if this is exactly how it supposed to be and I just happen to not liking it; or I can get better croque madame somewhere else. Fresh melons were cool and sweet, though!   Overall, there are few things I like about this place, especially their decor. There are also basic things I can care less for, that they can improve on. The 3 stars were given for the layout, service, and suki's bowl.

I love summer.  Not because we become nocturnal and have to hibernate during the day.  I love summer because I get to drink iced coffee.  Up until a few months ago, all I knew was that I loved iced coffee, didn't really think about who had the best . . . until I had Hillside's iced coffee!!!  How do they do it?  How can it be so delicious?  I never noticed being impressed at other places and now nothing seems to compare to Hillside's.  I have been back three times just for the iced coffee and to see if it was a one time thing, but it was not.  Each time the iced coffee (with just a hint of milk, no sugar) has blown me away!  And the cherry on top?  Cheddar Bacon scones!  Yep, I said it!  I have never really been interested in scones before and have always claimed to have more of a savory tooth than a sweet tooth.  Blueberry, cherry, eh.  When it came to take it or leave it, I always left it.  Today, I had to take it!  This morning, I saw the delicious Cheddar Bacon scones in the case and had to have one.  I was not disappointed.  Light and fluffy, chunks of bacon, yet each bite was nicely balanced and not over powered by either cheddar or bacon.  Oh Hillside Spot, I heart you!  Update 8/2:  I finally have an answer to my question "How do they do it?  How can it be so delicious?"  The answer is they get their coffee from the Cartel Coffee Lab.  Who knew!?  We do . . . now.  Check it out. http://www.yelp.com/biz/cartel-coffee-lab-phoenix#hrid:w6hrU_1NGdkAGEM2B_ot1w
We love love love Hill side! We have breakfast here a few times a week and it's always delicious!
Great place!  Food was fresh and even during lunch, when it was super busy, the food came out fast.  Prefect spot to sit out on the patio.

This is such a cute place! I like that you order right when you enter and they bring you the food at your table or on the patio. Its simple and straight forward. I like the modern decor as well--comfy but simple. Theres plenty of light coming in--seems like a great place to lounge around after your meal, chatting or reading a book. We went for brunch and split the croque monsieur and flaco torta. I loved the torta sandwich--the chorizo was spicy and I loved the slices of avocado. The open face sandwich was good as well, but my gf kept wanting another bite of my sandwich! I had a great iced coffee drink as well. I've heard they started offering dinner and happy hour as well..if only I lived nearby!! I would hit this place up all the time!

This is the closest local place open early for breakfast that we could find.  When we came in we figured out it is seat yourself. I like that! We didn't sit outside because it is hot already in the morning. We did sit by the window which was close enough to outside while still enjoying the great AC inside.   This place did not disappoint. On the menu is a note stating everything is made fresh and prepared when YOU order. Perfect!  We took a while to read everything on the menu, the waitress was patience enough with us and helped us finally decide what we wanted to order.   Once we ordered the food came fresh and delicious. Eggs were cooked to perfection and potatoes were heavenly.   We took some pastries and cookies for the road. Melt in your mouth deliciousness. We will be back for lunch or dinner on our next visit.   Walking out noticed there is a sign letting customers know if they can seat themselves or wait to be seated. Also note they serve local craft beers. Morning so no trying this time!

Server was very nice.....35 min.wait after we ordered to get simple breakfast. Charged extra for hashbrowns on a standard egg breakfast....1 small piece of toast instead of two. had to ask for extra syrup. One half of one ounce is what they give you ..They cut too many corners for their higher prices

I went here last Sunday, it was crowded but decided to wait out the 30 minutes. So glad I did! It was cool walking in to a cafe serving coffee, lattes and more! They also have coolers with all types of craft made beers. That day there was a lunch special on their watermelon margaritas which were good and refreshing on that hot day.  The food prices aren't the cheapest but the food is pretty good. It's a place with trying.

I had heard good things about Hillside from various friends, and so my husband and I decided to try it for a mid morning brunch. We walked in around 11:30 and the place was packed, so we assumed we'd have to wait for a table. We were given a menu to look at while we waited, and 5 minutes later were led to our table.   Our waiter was very friendly and attentive, and he filled our waters regularly throughout our meal. The breakfast menu had many options, most of which were southwestern cuisine. There was also an option to create your own breakfast sandwich.  We have not been for lunch, but with our breakfast experience and the promising menu options, we'll probably be back for lunch.   The outside patio area looked inviting, with comfortable seating and a fire pit. I'm sure it's very pleasant in cooler temperatures.   The coffee bar at the front of the store was very accommodating for someone who doesn't always have time to sit down for a meal. It looked like you could order any beverage and various food items from the to-go coffee bar. I'll definitely be back in to get some of their delicious coffee!  I definitely recommend Hillside for breakfast or brunch... Or at least for their coffee!

Enjoyed a delicious breakfast with the family today at a local favorite. Started off with an almond milk latte and blueberry muffin. Husband and I split the El Gallo Torta and Breakfast Burrito. Managed to get a pic of 1/2 the a burrito but the torta was devoured before I remembered. I highly, highly recommend both SO GOOD! You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu here. Great for coffee, baked goods, breakfast and lunch. The market place offers a great selection of wine and craft brews to take home. It always free good to support local business so be sure to stop in soon!
Really cool environment with lots of diversity.  Their food quality is really good and fresh. Very friendly employees and the service was fantastic.
Love it.  Bread is amazing, good atmosphere and yummy fish fry on Friday nights

Hillside Spot is a great little restaurant with a mini market place.  Great food, wine & craft beers.  I like their iced tea as well. Decent happy hour food & drink specials.  It's a great place for business breakfasts or lunches.  Nice patio and indoor seating.
I love this place for breakfast!  The servers are friendly and the food is delicious.

Hillside Spot is easily one of my favorite restaurants!  I've been here many times and not once have I been disappointed.  I don't know exactly what their secret is, but their food is ALWAYS the best.  I have a sneaky suspicion that is wood grilled meats, or maybe just a secret spice in their marinade/rubs.    From breakfast to tacos or pasta they are number one! Hillside is one of the BEST restaurants in the valley.
One of our favorite breakfast spots. Food is good as well as the atmosphere. If you are looking to try local craft beers, the is a great place.

I really like this place because they get all their ingredients from LOCAL shops/markets and farms, which is so awesome!   Their food is great, unique ingredients on many of thier menu items. I had the "Flaco" Torta, which was basically egg white, avocado, spicy aioli on a sonorense telera bread from a local mexican bakery. YUMM. Best sandwich bread I think I've ever had.    Great little hipster cafe, definitely stop by here and support a local cafe and all the local businesses they work with :)

I love this place. The burritos are so good, esp. The breakfast one! Sometimes it is hit or miss but honestly there are some wonderful people are servers there. My boyfriend hates all but one IPA and it was awesome that one of the guys there was able to find something close to what he liked. Always friendly and accommodating.  The food is good but I love the people and environment!
Great food, amazing service! Their pancakes and omelets are extremely good and amazingly fluffy! The price is great also. The only thing I have to say is.. the flies ruin it all

I am going to say I have eaten here at least 30 times. It's a mile from my house, and let's face it, Ahwatukee does not have enough fresh, hip eateries. We have wanted so badly for this place to be a success that we have continued to eat here even when we have had the worst service imaginable, and even when the menu was going through its own growing pains, and even though we had some meals that were so ridiculously inconsistent it seemed impossible that the cooks were being given the same recipes.  This morning we went in for breakfast, and after a short wait we were seated. The server was delightful--friendly, but she also knew instinctively when to come and go. I saw a lot of new faces among the staff, and I also saw a lot of tables turn over, which used to be next to impossible since getting a check used to be like waiting for a dr.'s appointment at the VA. I remember so many times I got up to get my own drinks or even grab my own food from the window because the server was chatting.   They have also reorganized the menu, and I really like it--some of the same foods but with many more options like make your own omelets and burritos. I really hope they can keep it together. It's not like they haven't had enough complaints about the service. They know it's an issue. I hope they have found a way to solve it since we would like to continue supporting them.

I would say this place is really great for breakfast. I ate here for lunch today having carne asade tacos.  They were too dry. My sis had a hamburger which was good, she would not say great. The French fries were really good. Yum!  Other sister had a turkey sandwich which was good also.  Great service.

Pretty good food. Nothing that wowed me. Coffee was also good. Staff were attentive, but looked angry - no smiles when we were there on a Sunday. Also witnessed some pretty interesting gaffs - they brought our food to us twice (ooops), and while making the tea managed to spill most of the entire huge pot on the floor . . . Did I mention the frowns?

Decided to check this place out since I was in the area. Super busy but was seated right away at the bar. I ordered the El Guac burger, it was delicious.  Made exactly how I ordered it. It came with fresh cut fries too. Very tasty, I ordered it medium and the flavor was really good. Jon was our waiter, very nice and let me taste some beers before I decided on Four Peaks Kolsch. I would have given them five stars if it were not for the disgusting bathroom.

WHY WHY WHY is the customer service so inconsistent? Why aren't the servers taught to SMILE, be on top of refilling drinks and clearing tables???? People go for an experience and service. Please PLEASE teach your staff to give quality service. Patrons shouldn't be seen searching for their server just to ask for the check.   Bonus: food is always good.

Hillside is doing everything right,  EXCEPT the BREAD.  I looked past it the first time.  Called it a fluke, went back tried other thing.  But this bad bread ruins a whole sandwich.  It looks like European bread, it is NOT.  Hillside needs to change bread distributors.  It could be as simple as "La Brea" or even "Fresh and Easy's" new bakery products.  It is tragic because I love everything Hillside has done; the windows the open kitchen the casual environment remind me of the greatest restaurants in town; La Grande Orange, True Food and The Vig.  I would eat here weekly if only they weren't compromising on the bread.  To the owners, I plead, get some gourmet breads, European style, herb breads, Sourdough, breads, Whole Grain with Nuts, even sprouted grain breads if you want to cater to the super healthy, but the croissant-looking, Roman Meal tasting bread should go.

I really liked the pancakes I had, very fluffy. I think the maple syrup I got with them was natural and not from a bottle. The service was good and the decorations were very nice. Over all great experience!

At first when this place opened I loved it even though the service was awful (except for Nicole). The MJ breads and croque monsieur were fantastic. After Chris left though it has taken a dive.  The service the last three times "3"! I have been there has been terrible. The people at the counter acted like we were bothering them simply by placing an order ( I am very sensitive to being respectful or them because I know working with the public is really hard).  The egg/chicken dish I ordered was slimy and there were odd pieces of bone in the mystery cuts of chicken. The tortillas were burned and greasy. The glasses/coffee cups were dirty and there wasn't any cream for the coffee. Also the tables and chair were sticky. Please wipe them off!  Unless someone can convince me there has been a huge improvement, I will never go back. This is very sad because it was so terrific to start with and my kids loved the patio which is so fun.   It was fantastic for happy hour. They have had some great wines- especially the Klinker Brick.  Very sad.
I eat here often. I love the fact that there are no freezers. Everything is fresh. Breakfast pan cakes the size of your plate with apple compote. Yum!

While waiting in line to order, an employee waved my friend and I over saying, "I'll help you guys over here." Guys. Plural. He took my friend's order and then instantly wandered off, leaving me standing there wondering if he was coming back. He did not so I got in another line to order.   After fetching our own drinks, which we were not told we would have to do, we found the one available clean table in a sea of empty yet-to-be-cleaned tables. After about ten minutes, someone came to clean the tables around us, but just brushed the crumbs into the chairs and walked away. The tables were still visibly dirty.  The food was the only saving grace. I had the croque madame. My egg was cooked exactly as I ordered it. I enjoyed it a lot. It came with a "side of fruit," that was more a garnish than a side: a tiny metal condiment container with one blackberry, a few tiny cubes of apple and two slices of grape.   None of the staff seem to be interested in delivering a great customer experience for any one there. I won't be back.
One of my favorite lunch spots, love the BLTA but everything I have ever ordered here is yummy.. All the food is fresh and served hot.

Happy to post an update on Hillside Spot- 3 years later!  My friend took me here and I didn't even remember that I had been here before. I thought the place was large and had a great patio (with a fireplace) and mood-dim lighting. Since I forgot about my previous experience, I didn't even think to order the pulled pork sandwich. Instead I got the Brooklyn Chop salad: romaine, salami, pistachios, radicchio, sundried tomatoes, cucumber, cotija, tomatoes, olives, and red wine vinaigrette. We also ordered draft beers that were $2 off as a Weekday special. My friend got a veggie burrito.  Our server was great and pretty speedy with the beers and food. The salad itself was tasty but not as flavorful as the description presented it to be: it was mostly salami and lettuce, I saw a tiny piece of pistachio and a whole olive but no sundried tomatoes, radicchio, cotija cheese, cucumbers or tomatoes. All in all, it was a decent salami and lettuce salad with a tangy dressing. My friend's veggie burrito was pretty average too- steamed veggies on a tortilla shell.  Happy that this place has gotten better in my eyes but its still not as amazing as it could be. However, the patio and ambiance is good enough to just come for beers and escape elsewhere for a good meal.

Prices pretty good. We ordered a couple breakfast items and they were both warm/cold. We let our waiter know and he took care of it right away! He sent back our ordera and they made them fresh. The food was really good and tasted fresh. The peach mimosa was good and my girlfriend got a beer. The waiter also gave us 2 drinks on him for the food being sent out like that. I appreciated the effort he put forth and because of him and the delicious food I would recommend and will be back!

When I first saw Hillside Spot, I thought it was a new coffee place. I guess I was a little predisposed to think so (there used to be a Coffee Plantation there). I was happy. I could use a non-Starbucks coffee place in my neighborhood.  Turns out destiny had something even better in mind.  I had lunch at Hillside this very afternoon. After pondering the options (not many), I decided on the pulled pork sandwich, which comes with their own special coleslaw - not on the side, but on the sandwich.  I don't like coleslaw. I do not like it on a plane. I will not eat it on a train. I would not touch it in rural Spain. Coleslaw is not my thing in the sense that burning off my own eyebrows is"not my thing".  But somehow the cashier talked me into trying it. And I am SO glad I did, because the sandwich was excellent. I washed it down with a bottle of Mexican Coke (the good stuff) and considered it an excellent lunch. I may just have to rethink my stance on coleslaw.  The restaurant is clean, well-lit, and just about perfect for a weekend breakfast or lunch. The tables aren't too crowded or too far apart, and it has a nice contemporary feel. I am definitely going back.

Absolutely loved this place! It's more like a casual cafe type of place but their food is delicious, healthy and affordable. They also have live music- yesterday was a young couple & they were good!  Went in around 7:00p and was a bit crowded but we were able to get an outdoor seating immediately (on a warm day I would totally recommend the outdoor patio).  Service was quick! We ordered and within minutes the food came out.  My friend and I shared the "build your own grazers- American prosciutto w/fig jam & Brie w/tomato jam. The jams went well with the meat & cheese, so delicious!  For my entree I ordered the half salad half sandwich- asado salad & vegetable torta.  Both were good! The asado salad was like a Thai peanut salad. The vegetable torta was nice & warm; the bread was soft too.  For dessert we shared the red velvet cake- absolutely amazing!!  When we asked for the check, the waitress was able to split the check without a problem.   They also serve breakfast all day!! Who doesn't love breakfast for dinner?:)

I love that this place has good coffee and offers almond milk (but wish they had coconut!); which is great since Ahwatukee needs to get with the times and have a lot more options for the crunchy/natural&organic/dairy-and-gluten-free crowd that is rapidly growing.  However, while they have a walk-in and take-out coffee bar, it is definitely a restaurant. There's no place to really just sit and chill. Restaurant-wise, it's a little loud, but i really like their breakfast options, which they serve all day, and they are reasonably priced.  I don't drink beer and I haven't been there for dinner, but I guess they have a lot of craft beers and wines.  I just wish there was a nice, shaded patio with misters and/or more of a sitting area for those that just want coffee.

Gem of the Ahwatukee/Chandler area! Loved it so much the first time, I went a second time that same week! First visit I had decided to try the CHILAQUILES VERDES which had layers of corn tortillas with mesquite cooked chicken, Oaxaca cheese, spicy green salsa (not too spicy for a wimp like me) & 2 sunny-side up eggs (which I requested scrambled). IT WAS HEAVEN WITH EACH BITE! My date had and loved the PULLED PORK SANDWICH which had the special recipe braised pork, slow cooked on our mesquite fired rotisserie, served on toasted telera bread and topped with their homemade, spicy cole slaw. UN-REAL! My mouth is watering just thinking about it! It was so yummy, from the taste or two I was given.   Second time we went was for breakfast. I had the "El Gallo" Torta with scrambled Eggs, chorizo, tomato & avocado and  mayo served on La Sonorense Telera bread. The chorizo was just spicy enough which I liked. The only thing that would have made the meal perfect was if the torta bread had been toasted (minor, I know). I also ordered a side of hashbrows which were seasoned to perfection and nice and crispy.  A new favorite place for sure! Can't wait to go back and order the pulled pork sandwich for myself!
Can't stand this overrated place. Totally disorganized, mediocre food, the worst coffee you'll ever drink, and substandard service. Patio not dog friendly unless you have a service animal.

I love the city of Phoenix (at least in April), and this place is in a perfect spot. We were able to sit at a table outside and the weather and setting was perfect.  I ordered the regular pancakes with a side of bacon. Don't let the description fool you, it says the platter comes with only two pancakes, but they are gigantic! I was barely able to finish both of them with the bacon, and they were delicious. The decor is also really nice. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anybody.

I'm not a local but I stop by here almost every time I'm in town. It's easy to pickup some delicious food (and desserts shhhh...).  I like the outdoor seating to dine in some of the cooler months.  Note: The last time I was there I saw that they use Guittard chocolate in their desserts.. Guittard chocolate is made in my hometown in northern California and if you've ever had a SEE'S candy those are made strictly with the same stuff. I'd say it's a pretty quality place but maybe I'm just biased.
I've been there many times since they have opened but they atill just can't seem to get their act together.  This could be a great SPOT but it's just NOT.  Continue to be disappointed.  Service SLOW.

Very disappointed with their breakfast food. We came in on a Saturday morning and it was pretty busy. Started by ordering drinks - they don't carry any decaf coffee! For a breakfast joint not to offer an option of decaf coffee is pretty unheard of. For those of us who can't have caffeine or don't want to have caffeine, you will not be getting a cup of jo with your breakfast. My husband's cappuccino was good, but we've had better.   Now, onto the actual food. I ordered Farmer's omelet and my husband ordered El Jefe omelet. Farmer's was completely unseasoned to the point where it tasted so bland I would call it inedible. I called our waitress back and asked if they forgot to season it. She told me that we don't actually salt our food very much. I wasn't specifically talking about salt, but seasoning in general. I reiterated that there is zero seasoning in my food and it tastes very bland, and she offered me salsa in return. Salsa helped, but then all I could taste was the salsa.  After it was all done I walked away very unsatisfied with my food.  El Jefe was better, but again, not something to write home about. The toast that it came with was also pretty bland. Overall I think they are going for minimal clean ingredients, but ultimately failed at it because they served us food that tastes bad. Healthy food doesn't have to taste bland.

Love this place!! The HUGE selection of craft beers and micro they have available makes this a unique place to grab a bite. the food is excellent and the staff is always great! When they have their BBQ going, it is hard to drive by and not stop.  Lunch and Dinner are recommended. Haven't been for breakfast.

My family has eaten her several times and we have been pleased every time. Tonight they went above and beyond. I have celiacs and every time they are great about it. However, tonight I was even more impressed I am breastfeeding and need to dairy free as well. The waitress helped me find a meal that was gluten free and dairy free. It was just as good as normal too! I would recommend the restaurant.

Outstanding food!! Great, fresh, local, creative, unusual and tasty combinations. Service was good. Loved the patio on a nice sunny day! Unusual open commercial kitchen in the middle of the restaurant.  Prices are reasonable. Will definitely be back!

Was recommended by a friend. Walked in and checked out the menu - all sounded really good so decided to give it a try. Good in theory. Execution is another story. My food was not too good. I got the breakfast burrito with chorizo. Very little egg, too much chorizo which got old fast and the "potatoes" inside it were leftover french fries!!!  OMG - talk about a lazy substitution and a misdirection from the menu description. The tortilla my burrito was made with was also not great tasting and in the end, I literally just ate the insides of the burrito and left the entire tortilla on the plate. I also got a side order of a pancake with apple compote. This was recommendation from my pretty but poor excuse of a server. The pancake on its own had NO flavor. The apple 'compote' was a couple of flavorless, weird colored apples with the skin still on!  If it wasn't for the syrup, there would be no flavor to this $5 extra item.  In all, I paid a pretty penny and was left very disappointed.    My server was also a disappointment. She spent most of her time chatting with 2 girlfriends at the bar/pub area, letting my food sit for a bit. I could see all this and she didn't seem fazed. Then when she took my order, she never wrote it down and originally my burrito had to be remade because of her inaccurate placement of my order.  The server never asked me how my food was, didn't seem to notice I did not eat the tortilla portion at all. Didn't seem to care.  This was my first impression, first time at this restaurant.  It seemed to be a find when I first viewed the menu. Not your typical chain, some different types of food, but the execution of the food and the lackluster service made this a no go in the future.

Really wonderful - for breakfast, lunch and dinner!  Love the outdoor fireplace, the vibe, how they source local foods, how Everything is made on premises but... often WAY too loud and yes... the flies.
I've come here for breakfast a couple times. Service is always good and I like that it's a local place with good ingredients. I like to get the lox and levain open-face sandwich.

Great food, But patio furniture sucks. Makes for an uncomfortable and dirty kind of feeling. Now I was there about a month ago so I'm not sure if they got new furniture but overall awesome worth another visit

Looking for good Huevos Rancheros one Sunday morning and ran into the the Hillside Spot. Place was pretty busy but was seated quickly. Huevos Rancheros weren't exactly what I was looking for but they were still good. Chili Verde was a little tart but worked well with the eggs and tortillas underneath. I will go back to try the Chilaquiles. Stay tuned for that review..

After a long hike nothing is better than good food, friendly waiters and something cold to drink.  Found Hillside Cafe today after friends told us about it.  Inside and outside covered seating.  Market attached which is great if you want to pick up food fast and go. This place is always crowed so come early if you want a fabulous breakfast.The only set back is the one women who seats you with glasses can be a little nasty.  I watched her put people on the bottom of the list when they didn't want to eat outside .  If that happens go to the manager who is a doll.  The food is always fresh and served as requested. Would I go back  we have multiple times.

SHORT AND SWEET: Came for lunch on a Saturday at noon. It wasn't busy when we got there, was seated right away, but around 1pm it started getting crowded, the service was good, the food was delicious (pear, blue cheese salad ordered and it was fantastic!) the coffee was very good too. GREAT PLACE, cool ambiance. The End.

What a great neighborhood family friendly spot! The food is always fresh and the beer and wine selection is fantastic. The servers and bartenders are personal and welcoming. I live walking in and being greeted by Taylor, Madison,  and Jeremy!
Good food and good service in a convenient location to South Mountain.  Great place for a weekend breakfast!

This place has a great atmosphere. However, the quality of the food is inconsistent. That is something that needs improvement. I would still recommend it though, because it's such a nice place to sit and relax.

Very nice and busy neighbourhood breakfast place.  Closest comparison I can think of for such a busy place would be Liberty Market in Gilbert.  I had the Corque Madame.  Its was well done with the right amount of cheese and ham and the fried egg was good.  I was a little disappointed that the only side it comes with was just a fruit cup, but then, what kind of sides do U give to a carb heavy sliced of bread anyway ?  I guess fruit is the best choice in this case.  I saw the Huevos Rancheros my friend ordered, he liked it very much too, the server even offered him a side of a spicier salsa when he asked if the sauce was gonna be spicy.  He does have one little query, why does it not come with beans ?  It comes with potatoes and a fruit cup too but we asked the server about it and he says, they usually don't serve beans with huevos rancheros.  But those are two small things that did not affect my overall experience by too much.  Because based on what they cooked and offered, the food was well made and very tasty.    I will definitely be back again because the coffee is really good (no longer cartel but also a local brand, expressions), service is excellent and food is well prepared.  I don't know what kind of service the other people here received but we had a very good server who kept coming back to refill our coffee.  I did see that the table next to us with a different server were visibly displeased when their server was too busy running around to refill their coffees often enough.  Also the server did come over and apologize to them, when we got our food before them, though we got in behind them.  I guess you can't control the kitchen and maybe the server was a little younger than our server, thus might have appeared a little more rushed, but I dun recall him being rude or away for too long.  Their coffee cups stayed half full most of the time still.  I will need to come back again to sample the other food choices, apparently they serve a good dinner too.  I guess it would be prudent to come earlier here on sunday for brunch as the farmer's market in the corner brings in a big walking crowd.  I imagine on saturday it would be pretty packed too.
Great food. Fresh and very tasty. Would have given 5 stars but the service was bad. They need to invest in training their staff properly.

I can't believe the rating here!  We come to hillside almost every Friday, have tried a good bulk of the menu, and it is fantastic! Our favorites are the jefe omelette, the chilaquiles, the levain toast, and the tacos. Oh and the croque madame and the street corn. Their oatmeal is fantastic too... if you order a side of fruit you get the GOOD fruit, no water-logged cantaloupe infecting your strawberries. :)  The service has always been wonderful and we love the atmosphere. Seriously don't understand how this place could get a bad rating... I could bathe in their tomatillo salsa and my boyfriend always enters some other dimension while he's eating his jefe omelette it's that good.

We go for the mimosas in the morning (delish!) and the kids eat free (after 4pm) specials as night. I love the indie-vibe this restaurant exudes, while my husband loves the fact that there are so many local beers on tap.  Well done.

I've been to Hillside Spot a few times since they opened, but it's quite a haul from my home to get there. I made the trip Sunday and was sorely disappointed in everything except the service, which is the only reason this review is a 2 star and not just 1.   I ordered a burger and asked that it be cooked medium. Easy, right? Well, no. After quite a long wait (about 30 minutes, but it was quite busy, so that wasn't such a big deal to me), I got a well done, over cooked burger that was burned around the edges. My first thought was how in the world could such a horrible burger make it out of the kitchen? The chef should never have let that food leave the kitchen. The server should have been told the kitchen screwed up and then fix it. But no, that didn't happen.  Our server, Alexa, got right on the replacement. A manager came by and I tried to help him understand that the burger I got should never have made it out of the kitchen. Rather than take responsibility, he offered excuses about how busy they were.   When Alexa brought my replacement, the burger was almost rare. It was as if the kitchen was making a point...take the burger as we give it to you or you'll get it raw. It was done enough around the edges for me to nibble, but I didn't eat much of the burger. Thankfully, Alexa took the burger off our bill (but I did leave her a generous tip since she was the saving grace in this experience).  I don't know what's going on in the kitchen, but shame on the chef and the kitchen staff for not being able to deliver a burger cooked to medium perfection. I'd had burgers there before and I remembered loving the burger! But my experience yesterday showed a complete failure in both the kitchen AND management. It's as if the customer's experience didn't matter at all to the kitchen and didn't matter much to the manager.   Oh, and the omelet my friend ordered...well, I'd have sent that back too. It was dry and looked horrible to me. The omelet was supposed to have had goat cheese on it, but she could only find one little chunk of goat cheese on it. The mushrooms from my mushroom swiss burger helped make her omelet more appealing. This was her first experience at the Hillside Spot. Quite frankly, I was embarrassed at the whole experience....I took a friend to what I thought was a great restaurant, only to have a horrid experience. If y'all ever get your kitchen back in working order, feel free to reach out...maybe I'll try you again. But for now, given all the other recent bad reviews, I'll spend my money elsewhere.

Place was nice especially sitting outside having lunch, first it did a take a while to get menus and asked for drinks, once we got a server he was really nice and I ordered a IPA and tired tricerahops for the first time and it was delicious and after that I had a ballast point sculpin IPA witch is one of my favorites, me and my girlfriend ordered the brisket Mac and cheese and it was okay but bland, ended up wanting more food after we were done and ordered a bacon cheeseburger and it was delicious! It was a nice lunch and enjoyed it!

After several so-so visits, this one was finally decent primarily because the huevos rancheros was delish. Service was still lacking (slow and inattentive) and the kitchen always seems slow getting food out. My biggest complaint is the ridiculously large fake fica tree that takes up about 1/6 of the floor space. Tables are squeezed tightly together to make room for this monstrosity which requires servers and customers to engage in an impromptu game of limbo to get around it. It really needs to go.  I do hold out hope for this place and the huge patio has a lot of potential. With the right furniture and shade the patio could really be on par with the Vig.
I ordered the flaco burrito expecting it to satisfy me while being the healthier choice, but it was beyond delicious. So happy that I got something healthy AND awesome. The tortillas are the best!

The food at Hillside Spot is wonderful-- I've enjoyed both breakfast and lunch there a few times. However, the service is enough to make me not want to eat there anymore. Other Yelpers have described their service as "slow and disorganized," and that pretty much sums it up. It's a shame, because the atmosphere of the restaurant is cozy and cheerful and the food is delicious. The service is just not what it should be. I expect more.

Called ahead to confirm pet friendly, was told we could sit on the patio. Made arrangements with friends to meet there. Got to restaurant and was told that actually unless our 5 lb dog was a service dog, we could sit at a little table on the sidewalk, but couldn't sit on the patio. Understandably, they don't have a permit for that. So, my Mother sat outside of the open gate with the dog, while the rest of our party sat on the patio, because there wasn't room for a party of 8 on the sidewalk. Patio was nice, food was ok. Got a "fancy" burger, but it was over cooked and flavorless. Grilled cheese bread was over toasted and hard, kids cheeseburgers were over cooked. Service by waiter was good, hostess and I believe the manager were nice, but miscommunication was an issue. Maybe I just had my hopes set too high. Prices were good. 5 adults and 3 kids only $69.
I love Hillside! Quaint and hip! Food is great and service is great too. It's busy on the weekends so plan accordingly! (Busy because it's awesome)

I would actaully like to give another half star here, but haven't figured out how to do that. It's completely worth supporting this place - if you've read my other revues, you know I am a fan of supporting local food, and this place does a good job of providing that. I gave it 3 1/2 stars because it's hit or miss. I've been when the food is great and the drinks are great and the staff is really friendly. Then I've had days when no one helps me for a really long time (but walk by and look at me) ;), and the coffee was not so great tasting or the food was a little off. But I continue to go often. Usually their coffee is yummy, their pastries are always delicious, a man who I believe was the owner was very nice, and the tunisian salad (chicken added) was mouth watering (and that's a salad!)

How did I not try this place sooner?!  Living literally 5 minutes tops from Hillside Spot, I drove by many times and never really knew what this place was.  Man was I glad I finally got to see.  Mixed between a coffee shop, breakfast joint and bar. this place has a lot to offer not to mention a mellow laid back atmosphere that I enjoyed.  The bar also looked like it had a pretty respectable selection of draft beers.    The bacon and cheese omelet I ordered was great and also had a refreshing selection of fruit to accompany it.    This is a nice spot in Ahwatukee that I will definitely try again.
Food at Hillside is always super tasty. I think pricing is a bit high sometimes but considering they use local farmers and such it's a good spend. I loved when they had live music on the patio.

You know, Hillside really went downhill (unintended pun). It's to the point where I no longer eat there and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It used to be one of my go-to "spots" and I was very hyped up about the place. However, the quality of the food declined...badly. I'd like to give them the benefit of the doubt and say, "Well, maybe the last couple of times I was there they were just having 'off' days." But, it was those "off" days that don't really make me want to return. I hope they can turn it around, because Hillside showed so much promise early on.
Came here to give it another try. Food is good, service is always poor.  Very slow service with no character.   Done giving this place a chance.

we have eaten here several times, friends like it, and I find it ok.  service is always a bit questionable, slow, and a bit out of synch including the delivery of dishes to a party of 6 - team delivery possible instead of one waiter?  my group likes the patio seating but it seems stark...they need a creative person to give t some character.  had the homemade pasta with chicken - good dish.

One of my favorite local spots to eat in Ahwatukee. They have incredible breakfast burritos and other dishes for breakfast. Their Suki's Rice Bowl is probably one of my favorite dishes anywhere. They also have great tacos, burgers, and more. I have had one or two dishes that were only ok but that has been rare. The service is always pretty friendly as well. They also have a great craft beer menu with a mix of local and non-local beers.  Definitely one of the best in Ahwatukee.

Love this place. Close to my work. My collegues and I adore this place. My husband thinks its swish too. Delicious sandwiches and salads. My favorite is the croque madame- perfection every time. The sauce they use on it is brilliant. The coffee is nice and hot and pretty good for a plain old cup- but they do have a full service expresso cafe if you want something a bit fancier! The bakery sweets look yummy too but I havent tried them yet- but there is always next time! Service is friendly and prompt. It looks like they have a variety of beers and wines too if that is what you look for.  Atmosphere is bright yet relaxing and chill. This is one of my favorite breakfast spots.
Visited twice now, and the food and atmosphere was amazing both times. Favorite place in the valley!

Very disappointing...   I have been coming here for years and the quality has been consistently declining. Today may have been the final straw.   The last time I was here was with my girlfriend. We were seated on a hot day at the only table receiving full sun. The table was also rickety. When asked about moving the table or going to any of the other empty tables in the shade, we were told it was okay if we moved the table our selves.... Okay... The server was very nice, but very slow and forgetful. We ordered a coffee and a side of jam with the food. It took about 25 minutes for the food to arrive which is reasonable, but the server didn't check back once in this time. When the food arrived, no jam and still no coffee... fine it happens, not a big deal. So we ask the food runner to let our server know about the missing items... 10 minutes later she stops by, and we let HER know about the missing items. She scampers off and it is literally the last time we see her. About 5 minutes later the coffee is dropped off by someone else, and...still no jam.   At this point we have eaten everything except for the toast. My girlfriend still wants the jam so we ask for that... it arrives about 5 minutes later again. We finish the toast in a couple minutes and sit with an empty table for another 10, Until the general manager stops by with the check for us. We let him know about the issues we had and he says one word, "okay". Leaves the check and walks away. Pathetic.    To be fair the food was really good. That time...  I should say that I have worked in restaurants for 10 years. I have worked as a server, a bartender, back of house, and management. Virtually every position. I am very understanding and very forgiving. I tip well and generally try to make the staffs lives easier.      Today I was sat at the bar and service was fast and friendly at first. I ordered the two egg breakfast. An item I have ordered a dozen times. The item I ordered in the story above in fact. Unfortunately, the toast came out almost soggy. It was cooked on the griddle on one sided only. The griddle side was soggy with butter and the other side was completely soft and uncooked. Not a big deal I think, it has never come out like this before. It always has some crispness to it, even if they "toast" it on the griddle.  A couple minutes later the general manager walks by and asks how the food was. I let him know about the toast. He says one word "okay", then turns around and calls back to the kitchen to get another order of toast. Sure enough it comes up exactly the way it came out before. The server checks back this time. I pick up the toast and show her how it bends in half if you hold it on one end. It is obviously greasy and soft.   I try to explain that I've never had it this way before and I'm really not feeling it. I suggest that they may need to check whats going on with the ingredients or the kitchen. Instead of asking what they could do to make it right, offer something else, or offer to take it off the bill, she looks at me annoyed and says "Okay". They didn't even apologize. The GM was standing behind her listening to this interaction the whole time. It's just pathetic. On top of it the rest of the breakfast was disappointing as well this time, for example the hash browns were soggy and barely warm.   I know how to run a top notch front of house staff. Keep them happy and make the customers come back. The whole time I was just itching to step in and start fixing their problems. It is clear that the problems in the staff are coming from the top. I sure the GM has plenty of talents, but running a half way decent front of house staff is not one of them.   Because I have had enough decent meals here I could be coxed into coming back, but it would probably take direct outreach from the GM or owner at this point.
Well I went back and Good news! The portions are bigger! And what actually brought me back was their coffee. What can I say I appreciate a place that serves good coffee! :)
Worst food ever. Had the huevos racnhero's, disgusting. The cheese flavorless plastic, the salsa verde was soo damn salty. It was just BAD! I will never go back. Stay away. Not good at all.

I am a regular customer here, and the food is consistently really good.  For me, the breakfast menu in particular is amazing.  They have the best side order of bacon on the planet.  You get plenty of delicious, crispy bacon for the price.  The atmosphere is pretty good, but the clientele can be kind of annoying which is no fault of the establishment.  I go there for the food.  The bar stools are uncomfortable, and the service is inconsistent.  Some of the servers are fantastic, others mediocre--so depending on who you get the service can vary from great to not very good.  However, the food has been consistently very, very good.  In addition to the bacon, the omelets, breakfast burritos, burgers, sandwiches, and chorizo are all delicous.  The coffee is hit or miss though.  The bottom line is I don't know of a better place to have breakfast in Ahwatukee.

Had breakfast here recently with my hubby and any place related to LGO we are fans of.   The pancakes were gigantic and appley-super yummy. I'd love to go again soon to try something new but I have a feeling Liberty Market would be my first breakfast choice!
Never disappointed with this place. Servers are great, atmosphere can't be beat and the food is of another level. Only spot I go to for a good breakfast.
Their smoked ribs are excellent.  It is a very friendly, convenient place with a great atmosphere.

I love this place.  Great salads and dinner entrees.  Breakfast is very busy though and I have gotten cold food.  Wish they were a little more consistent.  Great place for dinner since it's not as busy.
Really like the local menu and vibe.  Food is good and so is service. Wish there were more of them.

Hillside definitely hits the Spot!   There aren't too many great options for breakfast/lunch near my office at South Mountain, so I was thrilled to find that I really enjoy this place.
