Their version of chilaquiles is two corn tostadas with meat in the middle, bland, watery, green "salsa" pored over the top, and two eggs on the side..... Umm.... That is in no way chilaquiles. We also tried their house pancakes... yet again another letdown. Absolutely nothing special about them and they left a strange bitter aftertaste in your mouth as if too much baking powder was used. Syrup had no flavor and tasted watered down. Over all not impressed with this place which is a major shame because my husband and I like to support local small businesses. They only thing that earned them two stars was their vast selection of beers. They do have a very impressive beer list, however, I do not think we will be returning. What a shame.

Great food! I have never been disappointed here. You cant go wrong with the chicken, it is always perfect! The other reviews about poor service were right a few month ago, the service has greatly improved. I highly recommend this place!
I am a really big fan of their food. You can tell they make their food with love and quality ingredients. Get the pancakes!!
The service was very laid back...a bit slow...but it's a great spot and I wasn't disappointed in my mimosas or my omelette. Really nice atmosphere inside and the patio looked lovely.

My wife likes this place and that's why I've been several times. Since I can't complain to her I'll complain to you! Each time I come here I hope maybe this is the time the food wows me. Spoiler: it doesn't. Every meal I've had here is wildly mediocre. The desserts are good.  I was really quite upset on my last attempt though.  Usually I order breakfast/brunch items but seeing as I've had no luck with those I opted for a simple sandwich. Something basic so I would at least not have a bad lunch. I went for the tuna melt figuring even if they opened a can of tuna, mixed in a scoop of mayo, put it on toast, melted some cheese and charged me $9 it'd still be good. Oh, how I wish they just did that. It was, quite honestly, disgusting. The tuna, what I could taste, seemed to be chunk light and had a cornucopia of items mixed in. This included fruit. Fruit in my tuna salad. There were so many things mixed in I could barely taste the tuna OR cheese. The bread it was on was good. I should've just ordered toast. Additionally, while the fries are made in house they are not good either. Clearly they're not blanched because they're soggy and had no seasoning. Lastly, as you've read in many of these other reviews the service is pretty shoddy.   It is a cute restaurant with all the signs that it'll be good but be warned; looks can be deceiving.

Note to wait staff and hostess: seating people and waiting on them is your job, not a favor that you are grudgingly performing.  Smiling costs nothing and mqkes a good impression. Please don't reach across someone's plate, right in front of their face to hand something to another diner, that is just really rude. Let people taste the meal before you ask them if it is ok. When serving wine, don't just plonk it on the table and walk away.  Make sure it is the right bottle, open it and let someone taste it before leaving.  If you have cleared away the plates and cutlery, bring forks when serving dessert.  The wait staff has apperently never gotten any training. They seem nice, just clueless.  The food was nice, but not nice enough to overcome having to walk over to the wait staff to ask for what we  needed. Yes we got a bottle of wine, but not the one  we had ordered. We had to go and ask for the beer. We had to go and ask for lemon for the salmon... it's a lot of work to patronize this resurant, and if I wanted to work this hard, I'd just cook a meal at home.  This was the second try. Won't be back.

Parking lot is somewhat challenging.  Spots are big enough to easily accomodate smaller vehicles, and now that ACE Hardware is gone it looks like there will be more spaces available.  Free reign to park bad.   There's one bistro set just to the East of the entrance where you can dine with your dog.  They have a patio here, but do not allow dogs on their patio.   Can someone explain the reason for this when Uncle Bears, just up the road will allow dogs on their patio. Alright, nevermind.  Okay, let's just go inside.  Trendy atmosphere.  Its casual, low key and set up nicely.  I like their industrial displays of drinks and other edibles.  Rustic boxes and metal crates accented with galvanized buckets filled with schtuff bring the comfort of memorbilia that doesn't overwhelm to the point of tacky. Clientele this early morning was primarily business meetings which soon turned over to neighborhood folks with kids, etc. as it got closer to 9 a.m. My oatmeal is average.  Just a tad soupy for me.  But it comes with brown sugar and raisins, and server brought cream at my request.  And no additional charge.  TYVM. My side of ham wasnt much more than what appeared to be a couple slices of deli ham.   My company had the pancakes with Apple compote.  The portion was equivalent to maybe a quarter of an Apple and looked more like sauteed than a compote. Taste of pancakes ranked as pretty good. Now the water. That's Phoenix city water - unfiltered, nastiness.  Strangely enough the server tells me they have a filter on one of the other water sources but what they give customers is not filtered. Now that's a way to encourage someone to order something other than water. Overall, fair seating area (but the chairs are small/short), food good, service good, water horrible.
If you're in Ahwatukee and you're hungry . The place to go is hillside spot great food great atmosphere great spot to take the family. You will not be disappointed.

This is easily the best breakfast place in Ahwatukee, probably in the East Valley.  It gives high quality, organic places like Joe's Farm Grill and Liberty Market a serious run for their money.  The first time we tried Hillside Spot, they had just been featured in the AZ Republic.  When we arrived, they were turning people away - they couldn't handle the volume.  Each additional time that I have been for breakfast (always on a Sat or Sun) it has been crowded, but not mobbed.  We usually wait about 5 minutes for a table.  The food is amazing.  Large portions of good, high quality food.  I love the Croque Monsieur - a thick slab of frilled french bread slathered with bechamel sauce and topped with thin-sliced grilled ham, melted Gruyere cheese, and an egg (the egg is optional, and is added at no charge).  My wife had the huevos rancheros.  The salsa verde was fantastic and the potatoes were great, but I found that dish to be a little boring.  The pancakes look fantastic and the coffee is really, really good.  They use an open kitchen design so that you can see the food prep, and every single dish looks incredible.  I have not been here for lunch, but the burgers look excellent.  I am in love with this place, but am going to give it a 4 just because its still rather chaotic in here.  I was confused about how to get my drinks, the waitresses run around yelling out your name as they deliver the food that you ordered from the register, and it is often just a bit overwhelming.  On the other hand, this is only because the place is so good, and people are starting to figure it out.  I am SO glad that a place like this exists in Ahwatukee.

Early breakfast-right when opened-the Croque Monsieur-good sourdough bread w/ham slice and sunnyside egg/great. The fresh squeezed OJ, with Rebecca's Early Bird Granola/loaded w/fresh fruit pieces, nuts, and cinnamon granola, finishes out a great meal.

This place is amazing. From the chill urban vibe to the delicious food, it always hits the spot. Everything is fresh and the coffee is spot on. Blake is the best server, make sure to ask for him the next time you go in! My favorite brunch place.

Love this place!  Friendly staff, great coffee, and the best pancakes in town!  The Hit-the-Spot pancakes are a must try!  Fun place for evening coffee and dessert too.  Try later in the evening, and you might get free dessert as they clean out the case for the next day!

Nice little spot. Had the chilaquiles verde and the lady had pancakes, and ordered a side of hasbrowns for an extra dollar! Chilaquiles were incredibly flavorful. She said the pancakes were tasty, covered in a drizzle, bananas, and candied peanuts. She also said the pancakes without the toppings would have been pretty plain. The service was fast and friendly however no check back on the food until we finished. Would have been a 5 star however the hashbrowns were incredibly, almost inedibldy salty as well as our eggs were both overcooked and brown on the bottom (I ordered over easy she had over medium).   On a different note they have a marketplace to by the beers that they serve in house and a build your own six pack option which is pretty neat.

Great spot! Much bigger than I expected. The Hillside Reuben was great. Would definitely come back and try again. Only four stars because we had to wait a while after we were done eating for our check and never got drink refills.

I came here for lunch - but was stoked to find out that they offer breakfast till 4pm! The rest of my party got sandwiches and burgers but I got the Farmer omelet. It was egg whites only, with spinach, mushrooms, red bell peppers, and zuchinni. It was AWESOME!   I also got their latte so I could gauge the quality of their coffee. It was really good too! Kudos, they also have soy!   I can't wait to go here again, so take the following with a grain of salt. The downers? Well, there are SO many flies inside! I think they can open up their windows when it's nice out in the mornings, so that's probably where they all come from, but it's kind of obnoxious. Also, sometimes their service can be a little disconnected, however today I had two really good interactions with the staff.   Next time I'm going to try some of their salads or more breakfast items.   A suggestion to the management? Turkey burgers! The beef burger looks SO good, but some of us don't eat beef. Looking forward to it!

Good food, laid back, good beer choices... great place if you're looking for a sit back place to enjoy time with friends or family and want good food but don't need stellar foodie meal. The mix match 6 - pack of beer is good deal if you want something to go and keeps you from making that extra trip to liquor store. Only negative we've had here is the service can be slow. It seems they assign tables in rotation order instead of zones so wait staff is all over the place and can't attend to tables as quickly.
One of the best in Ahwatukee. Serving great food and adult beverages. Live music sometimes. Over all good. Service could be better. Dog friendly.

I absolutely love the food but the service here is absolutely horrible. I have been here multiple times and I get no drink refills, my food arrives cold, and I can even find the waiters to even get what I need. I'm very frustrated that such a great Good literally has the worst service in town. Please retrain your people to be responsive!!!

I love this place. I feel like I am in a piece of SF or Portland, but better since it's in Ahwatukee! Super convenient after a South Mountain hike and the food and drinks are amazing! Their beer selection is good and supports local beer and their fries are hand cut. I have eaten there for brunch and lunch. I would give this five stars if the service was better. It can be spotty and very inconsistent. I would also probably vist more often if the service was good...but the food is pretty fab.

First time visit and I'm a fan. The patio is great with a nice fire for the cooler nights. The menu is expansive (and a little overwhelming) with a variety of apps, noshes, and main course items. We tried the chicken quesedilla and it was really good.  The beer and wine menu is impressive- you can select from a really impressive variety of beers both bottled and tapped. Most of the options are micro-brews from all over the country and even a good few from AZ. Happy hour prices are great and my wife felt like the wine selection was really good, both white and red. Our server was friendly and didn't hang over us while we decided what to order. He kept up with us as we ate our food and sipped our drinks- offering suggestions along the way. We will be back to Hillside for dinner sometime soon!

Back here after a four year absence. Hillside Spot never missed a beat.  My wife ordered the huevos rancheros. I ordered the El Jefe omelette and subbed out chorizo for Bacon.  Since everyday can be a cheat day, I ordered a banana/Nutella crescent and split it with the rest of our party. It was absolutely delicious.  A slam dunk. I was told the huevos rancheros was as delicious as before. The El Jefe omelette was ok. I have had a lot of omelettes and this one was a little flat, full of ingredients, but a little crispy.  The added jalapeos gave it the right amount of heat and the subbed in bacon gave it a healthy crunch.    On a side note, our server Christen was very attentive but a little snooty.

We happened upon this place while looking for a quick meal and a nice place to study and read. After a short wait, for which they were very apologetic, we were seated on the patio. Although crowded, the noise level was pleasant and it was bright and airy. I ordered the half sandwich half salad, which was tasty but not super filling. Maybe I would have had a different experience of I'd ordered meat. My partner ordered the daily special which was a brisket sandwich and a side of coleslaw. He said it was good and seemed satisfied. The place cleared out a bit while we ate, so we stayed to read, study and use the decent Wi-Fi. All in all it was a pleasant experience, and I'd definitely return, especially for the patio seating.
I love this place, great people, great food and it's always my first go to local spot to head too when I have friends visiting from out of town. You are all killing it!

Best food. Worst service every single time. Does it stop me from coming?? No... Please Hillside!!! PLEASE retrain your staff. There was nobody in there and we waited for 35 minutes for anyone to ask us if we wanted anything to drink.  So sad

Not impressed. I brought my family here from out of town and was highly disappointed. Our waitress was out of sight literally the entire time, the food was cold, people behind us got theirs before and had barely sat down. When I informed our waitress of the situation and dissatisfaction she seemed bothered and failed to empathize. When brought the new food out it was always other workers and still cold, hash browns are the worst. Will not be coming back
Really great spot to eat, breakfast served all day. They have a great menu and an outside particular with a little for place. The staff was really laid back and timely. Would visit again.

Hillside Spot is one of my favorite haunts in Ahwatukee.  Very chill and relaxing atmosphere, I love to sit on the back patio around the fire during the cooler months.   Timeliness of service has never been a problem.   The Norteo Burger is certainly a favorite.  You'll find a blend of ground beef, chorizo and green chile sure to set your world on fire.   Get it with the fries and their famous aioli dipping sauce, the stir-fry vegetables if you're watching your waistline.  So many beers and wines to choose from, you're sure to find something you'll enjoy.  Also it should be noted, breakfast is served all day - So if you're a crackhead like me and want that delicious egg, chorizo and potato burrito at 7PM - Do your thang, homes.

5/27/10  After reading a couple of reviews on Hillside Spot, I decided to check it out myself.  Besides noticing that the line was still long, despite it being around 1030-1045 on a Thursday morning, I also noticed that this place gets NOISY!  I didn't care if it was full-on sun outdoors and already hot, I could not, and would not, bear the noise indoors :(, and apparently a few customers had the same idea, bec. the only available tables out there were lacking umbrellas.  [I'd give 4 or more stars if it wasn't so loud!!]  Don't fret, though, as I found one of the staff was willing to set up a table w/ an umbrella- all you have to do is ask!  I already checked the menu online for ideas, so I already knew what I might want to try.  Bec. of the crowd and the noise that greeted me on this first visit, which jarred me and had me scrambling for some space, I wasn't able to check out the display cases and counterspace w/ their array of pastries- cupcakes, apple pie by-the-slice, cookies, tarts, muffins, and scones, which vary daily.  Do check them out!  (The apple pie is so so good!)  The daily special sounded good, but I decided I'd try the Croque Madame (a Croque monsieur topped w/ a fried egg) and the Pancakes w/ Apple Compote.  Ordering is at the counter where you pay and take a card to mark your table w/.  It takes awhile for your food to be prepared, so keep this in mind when you do decide to visit.  I'd say this would be a good time to check out the pastries, but depending on how busy HS gets, you may want to place all of your order selections in the beginning and get it over w/.  The croque madame is simply outstanding!  Well, except for the burnt bits.  The French bread (from MJ Bread, I believe) was just perfect, topped w/ a fantastic bechamel sauce, sliced ham, melty gruyere cheese, and a fried egg!  This is definitely an item I would order again and again!  The pancakes were good (loved the batter mix!), but "apple compote," this wasn't!  OK, I admit, the compotes I've had thus far were fruit reductions that were thick and sweetened from the natural juices, as well as added sugar, so perhaps Hillside Spot's "apple compote" technically qualifies as a compote (as defined by dictionary.com- "fruit stewed or cooked in a syrup"), but I found the topping as neither sweet nor stewed enough (the chopped apples still had a lot of crunch in them!).  Thankfully, I had my bottle of pure maple syrup in my purse to sweeten the pancakes!  :)  7/24/10 I visited HS for a second time in early June and tried the berry pancakes w/ homemade whipped cream.  These were delightful!  I almost ate the whole thing, and had I not tried the apple pie, I definitely would've polished them off.  The added bananas (perfectly ripened) took this dish over-the-top!

Service: Coffee was cold on delivery from server. Asked for new cup, coffee was cold on 2nd cup. Waiter seem to just not care, I'll live without coffee, no big deal. Asked to have it off the bill, not done.  Never drink it, waiter never asked how was breakfast, was the coffee nice and cold, is it raining, do I care?   Called next day, asked to speak to manager, let them know I just thought they shouldn't charge for cold coffee, response was " is this really that important? ". I asked then to speak to a manager which is the point of this review and left my name and phone number and received no phone call back.

Just went there for breakfast. It was a complete disaster.   We waited in line for 5 minutes for the hostess to take our name and then waited 15 minutes after that to be seated. This was a little frustrating since we could see there were open tables.   Once we were sat on the patio, the waitress took our drink order and didn't come back to take our food order for about 15 minutes. She seemed annoyed and indifferent.  We waited FOREVER for our food. People around us were clearly as displeased as we were. The waitress never came over to refill our drinks or offer any explanation for the wait. It was almost as if she was avoiding us. We just sat and waited, getting more annoyed every minute. We watched as tables of customers sat with no food and the staff milled around, no pep in their step, no sense of urgency. They all seemed like they really could not care less about their jobs and their tips.   When we finally got our food it was nothing impressive. We basically got an $8 slice of bread with some ham and cheese on it. Nothing anyone couldn't make at home. Never got a refill on our drinks. Food was edible but I wouldn't call it "good".   The waitress explained, after I asked why it took so long that 3 people in the kitchen had walked out so that's why she was frustrated. SHE WAS FRUSTRATED? I couldn't believe she had the nerve to say that when she wasn't doing anything to make up for it. I would respect them if they looked like they were trying but they really weren't.   There was no sign of a manager or owner. It looked like a bunch of sloppy, apathetic kids with no guidance working there. If your kitchen staff walked out that's a clear indication of a problem.   It's too bad because the ambiance is cute and hip, and this area could really use a privately owned spot for breakfast, but all in all, I would say DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY on this poorly managed joint. We won't be back.
I had the chopped salad for lunch today.  It was delicious!  The service was very good, too.

I love the location.  The place has so much potential the food is not great.  I love the items they serve but the taste is off,  the omelette are dry and over cooked, if you order a English muffin you get 1/2 and it's not even toasted.  It's sad because we are so limited in ahwatukee on decent places to eat.  The concept is great and they stay in business not because it's good food and good service it's more because we don't have any options.  The place is dirty as well.  I wish the owner would go drive out to liberty market (Gilbet)and see what they are doing out there and bring it here. It's worth driving to Gilbert over coming to hillside.

I can't comment on the food because we didn't get that far.  The place had a less than pristine feel when we walked in, but we were willing to overlook that.  It was when we watched the hostess toss her hair around (literally bending over at the waist to flip it forward then all the way back) and proceed to put her hair up in a ponytail, take it out and then repeat the process, that we decided we didn't have the stomach to eat there.

We were heading to Chandler, and decided to stop here for a late lunch.  Hubby had read about it, and thought it would be perfect for us.  It wasn't really busy, since we arrived around 3:30ish on a Friday afternoon.  We got a nice table, and had a very friendly waitress come right over to us.  We wanted some guacamole and chips to start off, but I don't like jalapenos (which are in the guac), and she said they make it fresh, so they can leave those out.  As soon as I heard that, I knew I was going to enjoy this meal.  Hubby decided to also get himself a bowl of clam chowder (which he has to try wherever we go).  The guac was incredibly creamy and delicious, and the chips tasted freshly made, as well.  Hubby's chowder was gigantic!  He truly didn't expect that much, but he loved it, and finished every last drop.  For our main courses, hubby got the fish & chips and I ordered the tuna melt.  I realized what a picky eater I was, when I mentioned that I didn't like the outside of the bread to be buttered (I hate the greasiness when it's made that way).  Our waitress told me they don't use butter on the bread, it's put in the press without it.  Awesome!!!    Hubby's fish & chips were really tasty and crunchy.  He loved the batter, and it came with a chipotle dip instead of tartar sauce, which he also seemed to really like.  The fries were handcut and quite tasty...not overly salted.  My tuna melt was served on "lavain" bread (I think that's what it was...sort of a mix between sourdough and seedless rye), which had a really nice flavor.  The tuna was quite good and had a few golden raisins in it.  They added a nice burst of sweetness every now and then.  Everything was delicious, and the wait staff was quite friendly.  We both enjoyed our meal, and would definitely come back whenever we're in the area.
I love this place!!!!!!!! I wish I could give it more than 5 stars.. food rocks, everything is fresh! Diverse menu. Staff rocks! It's a very positive atmosphere all around!!!

I love coming to Hillside Spot! They have delicious food and it's a great environment. I tend to get the tuna salad sandwich every time, but why mess with something so good? I defiantly recommend it or their salads! It's a great place to eat at!!

I don't live (and I'm never in) this area, but I happened to be at the high school down the street from this place with my running group and we stopped in after our run. I thought it was pretty tasty.   It was (kind of) later on a Tuesday night so it wasn't very crowded. I liked the lay-out though. We sat inside but the patio looked nice. Lots of wood furniture and a semi-open kitchen. I didn't feel like a drink (shocker!) but they have a pretty extensive beer selection. In fact, I believe they have THREE gluten-free options (I'm not gluten-free, but a friend I often go to HH is, and I know gf beer options are often scarce).  The menu is kind of random, but I like it. They serve breakfast all day. Lots of tortas & egg options, but they pancakes and the like as well. They also have lots of salads, sandwiches & burgers. In addition, there's lots of Mexican (really I would say more like "New Mexican") meals as well. A lot of the breakfast menu has a "New Mexican" spin to it.   I had a veggie burrito that came with rice & beans. It was all very good. I liked it mainly because it was a good balance of being a hearty meal, that wasn't too heavy, but wasn't hoity toity either. This is how a lot of the food here seems to be. The kind of stuff that "seems" healthy (and some food can be), but really isn't (and that isn't a bad thing, I think). The veggies in the burrito were grilled nicely, and and had a lot of flavor. I also liked the fried rice it came with. Again, it wasn't too heavy, but still had flavor.   The prices here are reasonable for what you get. The service was so-so. Our waitress was friendly, but wasn't the most attentive.   Like I said, this isn't a part of town I ever come to, but I'd come back here if I ever find myself in this 'hood again.

Hillside, you urban hipster you, what are you doing in all-white- tookee with its' 5 series BMWs and Eddie Bauer car seats..you my friend are raking in the in crowd.   I hit up Hillside on a Sunday and had a brunch lunch moment. I had the croque monsieur and it was meh. The sauce had very little taste and was indistiguishable from the cheese. My husband had an outstanding Reuben, the pastrami was delish and the bread for both of us was great. We had iced tea - standard..  The wait staff was rather unremarkable. The open kitchen is relatively interesting..nothing too complicated happens so its' a little like watching Subway but hey its' urban hipsters making your sandwich.

I love this place!  Try to sit on the patio by the fireplace!  Breakfast and lunch are good.  The salad selection is very good as well.  I love the guacamole and Chips as an appetizer and the Pollo taco plate is delicious!  The happy hour is amazing as well!! Breakfast is quite busy... Just a heads up!

3.5 stars*** Hillside spot is our first time coming here and mostly the photos from Yelp persuaded our decision to come here for our Sunday morning breakfast.  I am so conflicted on how to review this restaurant because they ended up correcting all the wrongs however, it was a horrible first impression. We checked in and agreed to the 25 minute wait. Mistake number 1. We sat down and looked for a drink menu or Sunday Bloody Mary special couldn't find one. We asked the server for a cocktail list and it was beer/wine only. However, I later in the breakfast saw servers walk around with a watermelon mimosa I didn't see on the list or let be known to me. Mistake number 2. We ordered children's pancakes, hievos ranchos, a breakfast torta and an egg sandwich for later in the day when I feel like nibbling. Only received 2 out of 3 meals. Mistake number 3. Yes, our server comped the children's pancakes but  the pancakes weren't the issue.  We were impressed by other reviews but we most likely won't return for Sunday brunch.

Loved this place! We were looking for a burger, patio type place that served beer and for the most part we would feel welcome with our toddler. This  place was awesome. It looks like this place may be hit or miss, but it was an absolute hit with us.  We were promptly seated, offered a kids menu  and drinks and the waitress checked in on us as soon as we sat down. We thought the service was great. My husband had a flavorful and juicy burger that we both raved about and my rice bowl (I know-weird selection) was delicious and fresh. We were very impressed and can't wait to try brunch.  I'm a huge yelp reader, but I never write reviews and after our experience tonight I was compelled to say that I sure hope this place  keeps it up because our experience was  just what we hoped for on Friday night!
I enjoyed every bite but it wasn't exceptional. The smell when you walk in is far more engaging then the staff. Waited a little too long for some coffee and juice. Overall a nice spot.

My wife and I love this place for any meal of the day, whether it be breakfast, lunch, or dinner. There's always something on the menu that I can find enjoyable. I love the fact that you can get breakfast all day and their Cocina 55 menu after 4pm is excellent! The restaurant is a little small and we don't care much for their chairs, but if you're in the area and looking for something to eat, this is the place! They have tons of local beers on tap that you can choose from and you have to try their homemade chips, they're the bomb!

I have been going here for along time and I really loved it until Saturday.  My boyfriend and I went in about 130pm.  I had my service dog with me.   I went up to the hostess stand and waited.  The hostess was standing right in front of me ignoring me.  About 5 minutes later the manager comes over and tells me that I have to sit outside, it was raining at the time.  I replied this is my service dog so i would like to be sat inside.  He told me to go sit down because I would have to wait for an open table, even though there was plenty of tables.  We proceeded to wait 20 minutes until they called my name.  They walked us all the way back to the corner to seat us.   The hostess handed us our menu and walked away.  My dog had gone under the table and was asleep, where she was suppose to be.  Our waiter walked over and proceeded to tell me that I had to produce a service certificate for my dog.  I told him that I am not required by federal law to give him one. He then decided that he was going to yell at me in the middle of the restaurant telling me that the health department requires him to get a certificate (which is a lie, I talked to the health department) and that he is being nice allowing me to stay and eat.  He then yells "I bet its because you cant give me one thanks for helping out you community" and storms off.  The manager, if you can even call him that, was standing by the counter staring at this whole thing and does nothing.   I have never been treated with such disrespect in a restaurant.  The owner of this place should be ashamed for having such rude and condescending people working for him.  People who have disabilities shouldnt have to be verbally harassed when they want to get a bite to eat.
Delicious Breakfast, highly recommend the Breakfast Torta it's got Eggs, chorizo, avocado, tomato and eggs, very filling! also their coffee here is made perfect!

I had the Diablo breakfast burrito. It would have been good, if only they used more of the Diablo sauce. My wife had the Omellete El Jefe which I envied. Omellete el jefe. They have a great beer selection, the service was very attentive, and all in all I'd visit again while traveling through Phoenix.  I loved the little market with the "make your own 6 pack." We tried a lot of the local beers.
Just had takeout from here. Amazing as always!!! Had the carne asada torta. DDelish!!!!

We are regulars here and love it! Food is great and service is good! We've also gone at night for drinks and the bar is awesome.  Good brews on tap and a wide selection of wines. If you show up sat or Sunday around typical lunch times prepare for a wait!   This is honestly a hidden gem!   Also for previous reviews where they've rated the service low, this has changed. New management took over about 6 months to a year ago and they're way more on top of their waiters. Much improvement!

I was so looking forward to breakfast here. What a disappointment.  The food is the only thing that rates any stars at all. Good ingredients cannot be completely ruined by incompetent service.  The space is nice, but crowded and loud. The counter staff were indifferent. After being waved over to an open register, the fellow behind the counter took one order, then wandered off, leaving the rest of us to get back in line at the other register to order.  You are given a number (or not) and left to find your own table, scrounge up your own silverware, and wait for your food to be delivered. Except that the napkins are at a completely different station than the silver, they were out of forks, and most of the tables were completely filthy. I watched a busboy randomly swipe the top of a table, sweeping crumbs onto the benches and chairs, then leave an empty drink bottle on the table before wandering listlessly off.  Beverages are (apparently) serve yourself, although they didn't bother to say that when I ordered. I stood at the counter, waiting for iced tea, only to turn around and see that I was expected to get it myself.  If they happen to "run out of numbers", then they input your name with your order. Nothing irritates me more than to have my name shouted across a restaurant. Better yet, the waiters wander from table to table looking for their customers.... "Lisa? Is there a Lisa here?" while your food cools. Inexcusable.  The only bright point: the croque madame was tasty. Delicious bread, ham, and a perfectly fried egg. But the meager smear of bechamel and a thin slice of cheese were underwhelming. However, the "side of fruit" made me angry: a tiny metal creamer with 1 blackberry, a few slices of strawberry, and 2 chunks of  green apple. Insulting.  Fast casual, order at the counter works well when tables are clean and set, and the food delivery is speedy and efficient. Unfortunately this place needs some work in order to make it worth your time.

Food was great, our server Stephan (I think that was his name based on the receipt, forgot if he mentioned it in the beginning) was attentive and nice, and gave good suggestions. I'd been here a few times for breakfast but never lunch, but was very pleased with the food.
Food was delish, server was awesome. This is a great spot to go to when u want to enjoy a nice breakfast. I like sitting at the outside patio

Flies!!!!  Good God!  Will somebody do something about all the flies?!?  Inside, outside, doesn't matter. They are everywhere and your constantly swatting them away. Put in some fans to keep them off the customers and away from the doors.

2 reasons to come here: croque madame & Cartel coffee. Besides that...no reason. My husband and I have been here three times. Once, we were sat and then completely forgotten about for over 40 minutes so we left (no one even brought us water). Second time, they crossed our names out instead of another waiting couple so we waited for over an hour to be seated and were offered no apologies. Once we were seated, we were forgotten about again and ended up just leaving. Our third and final time, we finally were sat and able to order in a timely manor, but then no one ever came to refill our drinks or check if we needed anything. Such a bummer.

I wasn't impressed by this place. I had a 9 oz mushroom Swiss burger with Mac & cheese as my side. The Mac & cheese was soupy and nothing special. Seemed like cafeteria quality. The burger patty was nice and thick but really had no flavor, it truly didn't taste like anything. For a $15 burger, I expected much better

Went to breakfast with a friend.  Got the huevos rancheros, sweet crepes, and croque Madame.  Very good quality overall, only downfall would be slow service however the server was friendly and professional. Will definitely keep this place in mind for breakfasts to come (:

Nasty attitude and non caring. We called twice to see if dogs are allowed . Upon our party of 6 arriving and telling hostess we have a small dog . We waited 30 minutes . When our table was ready we were told no dogs inspite of 3x advising hostess . I called and complained nobody cared . Stay away from this dump ! Another dog was on patio with water bowls . I don't get if they must of played lead roll in dumb and dumber

The food is decent, but the service is horrible. No reservations on the weekend. The hostess had a smirk, heavy sigh and eye roll to match a surly teenager! The food runners had no idea who ordered what, and we had already waited a long time for our order, then had to help; further adding to the poor service experience! Coffee was good! Overall experience marred by poor service!

I love this place!  My fav restaurant in Ahwatukee!  I have been many times and it is always tasty!  Normally I get the burger!  So good!  I have also had breakfast here!  Mmm oh and salads are great! Service is great and you can sit outside if you would like!

Ok Hillside Spot, you had this coming for awhile. I have been here at least 15 times probably because it's the only place around that is not a chain and makes somewhat healthy/gourmet type food. That being said I always leave somewhat disappointed with the hope that next time could possibly be better. I have dined here for breakfast, lunch and dinner, with and without kids. The biggest thing I notice is the service is always horrible, just always. The food comes out very very slowly. The servers look like they have much more important things to be doing besides serving and are very dull and bland in personality and enthusiasm for the place. They just don't care. Once the server forgot my coffee the whole time and since he never came back until he dropped the check, I had to get a free coffee card for next time. On that, the coffee is good, but how can you really go wrong with Cartel?  Ok as for the chefs, why do they always forget stuff that should come with my food? There is no value here at all, it is very overpriced. The Tunisian salad I had was $9.58 with tax. the salad is just veggies and olives. They forgot my kale. $3, $4, and $5 more to add chx, shrimp or steak. The salad probably costs $1 to make unfortunately I feel cheated. It's not large, I am a 117 lbs girl so that is saying something if I feel the portions are too small. It was good though, I must admit but not even worth the price. The food is hit or miss. I like the grilled (elote) corn, the cheeseburger is pretty damn good, the bbq pork was good, guacamole is good. Levain and lox is amazing. croque madame is bland, vegetable torta not very good, tuna is boring, spot chop is ok....i cant remember what else I had right now.  All in all, please just step up your game, make sure those chefs are getting that food made right and timely and hire some servers who maybe give a damn. Think about the value of your food, run some promotions or something. BTW, I do like Gallo Blanco a lot, but again not a very good value.

This place has amazing food for such a small and quaint location.  I came in with the running group and ordered the Carne Asada Torta with a side of mexican corn on the cob, and it blew me away.  Some of the best food I've had in the area!  The service was a little slow, but not too terrible that would keep me from coming back.  I'm a fan!

cute hippie bohemian spot with homemade goodies in glass dishes...old schoolin' it in tukee....friendly waitress...had awesome carne asada sandwich...prickly pear tea...my boss had chili querdes or whatever that egg dish is called...looked great...it was all very delightful and tasty visit!

This place is the best !! I am a regular ! The nice relaxed vibe really makes the experience of eating here always a great one! Staff is always so friendly! Anything on the breakfast menu is amazing! Also a great place to go and just enjoy and nice glass of wine!

I hate hate hate that I have to dole out a fiver to Hillside Spot - To quote the paranoid pot dealing hippie from ''Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle', It's my baby.    HSS rotates a variety of killer local and  semi-local handles and, regardless of how overly complicated their menu is, the food fucking rocks. (see that side o' roasted corn? Get that shit.  It will change you).   HSS is a strange yet wonderful beast.  It's either crammed to the rafters randomly in the middle of the week or oddly (and gorgeously) bereft of any and all humanity.  The later is especially nice when I roll in after any form of exercise I deem 'worthy of a beer'.  Long story short, if you haven't tried it, try it.  But not when I'm there.  This is getting uncomfortable.

Looked like a good neighborhood place. Service was fair at best. We had some beers and appetizers which were decent. The problem occurred when the bill came. Our bill was just over $30 which we thought was great and saw they had applied the happy hour discount.  We put down two 20 dollar bills. When the change came it was shorted by about 3 dollars. We told the waiter who said he would fix it. He comes back and the bill went up by $3 and says the change was now correct.Not worth the fight but don't like getting jacked like that.

Its so wonderful to have a great place like this in Ahwatukee.  Pancakes are the best.  I said BEST!.  I really love the croque monsieur, but change it up to a madam by putting a fried egg on top.  Ask for extra bechamel sauce, they can be a little stingy with the good stuff sometimes.  They serve Cartel coffee here which as any good Pheonician knows is the best in the valley if not the country.  Fresh orange juice is great.  I did stop by once for a burger - which was good with only one caveat - juicy burger on soft bread with no layer of mayo (as Alton Brown suggests) to keep the bun from becoming a squishy mess.  Good fries, fresh cut and fried.
Hmm. Yeah, ok--p good. You should go here. You will feel cool here. Reasonable flavors. V convenient. No bees. Salt and pepper on the tables and whatnot. Good--yeah. Good.
Great spot with variety and quality food. Service was prompt and the omlets and chiliquiles were amazing. I was very impressed and eager to go back.

This is a go to spot for us for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. We are here pretty often, so can say that it is consistently good.   The breakfast sandwiches and varied egg dishes are delicious and satisfying. The pancakes are light and fluffy.  We mostly get chicken related sandwiches are the full mesquite chicken or salads for lunch and dinner. The chicken is always spot on and very tasty. We wish there were more vegetarian options since we have been underwhelmed with them before (other than the salads, which are great).   We usually get the fries for sides, which are great but the corn is fantastic as well.  They always have a handful of good beers on tap and a huge selection of cans and bottles.   Service is usually very good.   Over several years we've only had one bad food experience with the Friday fish special and it was quickly remedied.   We'll keep coming back and would  be here even more often if they had more veggie options.
BLT was good. Loved the bread.  The service wasn't all that and I was sitting at the counter and passed by my server several time. Doubt I'd go out of my way to come back.

I have been here 4-5 times and have had overall good experience.  Food has always been delicious for breakfast and lunch. The service had been occasionally spotty with long wait times to get a server, but once the server came over I've never had a problem.  I will absolutely continue to go and support this local business.

Eh. Was very unimpressed. Came here for Mother's Day breakfast as it was the only Ahwatukee area breakfast joint I could find with healthy menu options that wasn't a chain.   First, the ok part. The food wasn't bad. Nothing special, but not bad for a quick breakfast. I had the farmer's omelette with fruit on the side. My boyfriend got a breakfast burritto that he said was pretty good, but the "potatoes" inside were just french fries. Really?   We were seated on the patio, which was fine because it was fairly shaded. There were flys EVERYWHERE. I understand that there is only so much they can do when you're outside, but it was gross. and, the seat cushions were all filthy.   The service sucked. The hostess was just sort of dumb, and not especially friendly. We did get our drinks refilled in a timely fashion, which I appreciate, but our waitress had zero personality. zero. When we first sat down she came up to the table, without even saying hi, and took the sweetener packets off the table to give to the table next to us. Didn't say a word. When my boyfriend's mom asked about the hashbrowns, the waitress said "they're just hashbrowns". It's like she didn't know how to communicate with real people.   Given the owners of the place, I expected A LOT more. It's fine for a quick bite to eat, but don't expect friendly service our outstanding food. Ahwatukee could really use a quality breakfast joint, too.

Still love Hillside Spot.  The management seem to do one thing particularly well besides quality yum food- they seem keep their employees happy.  Many of the staff are have been employed there for years and are very professional, friendly and laid back group. Just a unique feature of this restaurant vs. others in this area.

Live in the area and really want this restaurant to be good. I imagine my SO and I riding our bikes and enjoying the beautiful patio. The soft wood smoke emanating from the cozy fireplace is alluring. Alluring that is till you sit down. Regretfully, the food is marginal and the servers seem aloof. For example, ordered a BBQ sandwich. The dry meat required more than the sparse amount of sauce served. I flagged down server. She brought a bottle cap size portion. When I received my bill they charged me for the "side" of sauce. OK, maybe my expectations are too high but that and many previous visits with unmotivated staff and Arby's quality food has forced my to ride on by.

Was here for breakfast earlier this morning.  Pancakes were nothing special aside from the toppings (bananas, candies peanuts and peanut butter). Ordered my egg over medium and it came out over cooked. Server was very friendly!  Iced toddy (cold brew) was also very good (I added vanilla and caramel to it).  I would give my breakfast experience 4 stars.   Came back this afternoon for the Happy hour spread and was way less impressed than earlier.  $10 graze board was good and our drinks (wine and beer) were also nothing to complain about.  We sat at the bar, where 3 different servers were standing. 2 were discussing how hungover they were from the night before.  One of them ordered a meal and then proceeded to eat said meal at the prep area in front of the food window.  We also observed one of the cooks wearing gloves take out his cell phone, text, put his phone back into his apron and then walk over and handle food from the grill/line (no change of gloves nor hand washing in between).  The ice bins were left open the majority of time we were here, and the ice bath the (uncovered) berries had sat in that morning was only water for our afternoon visit (berries still uncovered).    This might sound slightly nitpicky, however as a fellow member of the food service industry, my eye for food safety is always focused.  Because we did not witness the same conditions at breakfast as we did at happy hour, I wouldn't mind coming back for another morning meal. Past the breakfast hour however, I don't think I will be returning.

Despite getting pooped on by a bird whilst sitting outside waiting for my breakfast i have to say this was one of the best eating experiences ive had in a while... The service was great.. the food was phenominal.. And the prices are reasonable...
Deliciousness! Fresh ingredients, awesome atmosphere, fun decor, and great service. When you order a coffee based drink it comes with complimentary coffee-art!

Quality and consistency has definitely improved over the last year. The wood fired smoker/grill turns out some amazing burgers and roast chicken.  Breakfast is excellent as well. Beer selection is top notch for the 'Tuke AND you can take home a six-pack for a steal (if you pick the right ones).   Only suggestion is to get thicker patties for the burgers - the wafers are tasty but...

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  Been here for both breakfast and lunch.  Breakfast was bad, lunch was good, and I need to increase the sample size if I want to possibly up the rating here.  On this last visit I ordered the Brooklyn chop salad with a side of house made potato chips.  The chips were quite good.  And the salad was one of the better salads I've had.  Romaine, radicchio, olives, sun dried tomatoes, pistachios, salami.  The salad was not over-dressed and the mix of textures and tastes was good.  My friend ordered the Derby salad which I had a bite of.  It was fine - both salads were quite fresh.  He asked for his dressing on the side so his salad was also not over-dressed.  I would definitely come back here for the salads.  It's breakfast that really lowers this rating to just okay.  Ordered the chilaquiles and was sorely disappointed.  The serving was tiny, just a small handful of chips, that has been soaked through by the time they were served.  The sauce was underwhelming.  The egg was the only thing that partially saved the dish.  I vowed never to order it again.    I'm going to be back to give breakfast another shot, and I will definitely return for lunches here.  On balance though, will stick to the 3-star review until I taste more stuff.

One of the best breakfast places I've been to in a while. I can very much appreciate when a place takes the time to perfect fantastic quality food and service. Outstanding service by my waiter Taylor! Great guy! Would recommend this place to anyone.

I see this place has lost some stars recently.  I can only assume it's to do with the poor service.  Went for breakfast today at ten.  The manager took our drink order right away.  The waitress came by and asked our drink order and we said the manager was already coming back with our drinks.  She left immediately.  She came back after a few moments and said that she will be our waitress, implying there had been some confusion about that among the wait staff.  She left again without asking if we were ready to order, which we were.  Then a third time she comes back to take our order.  The manager drops the food off at the table and the waitress comes up about two seconds after that and asks if we're okay.  We don't see her again the rest of the meal.  No drink refills, no nothing.  Even after we were finished, we waited around for ten minutes for the check.  I'm extraordinarily understanding of bad service usually.  It's usually they're short staffed or due to shit management policies that fuck things up and not the server's fault entirely if at all.  But there's was a ton of wait staff there for the amount of customers.  The kitchen wasn't backed up apparently, as our food was prompt to arrive.  The waitress was just crap.  And she seemed totally oblivious to the fact that she was crap.  She was unfriendly AND incompetent.  You should really not be both.  I hope she finds a job that suits her better.  She's woefully bad at serving the public.  Points off the the manager as well for passing our table three times and not noticing our craning necks and empty cups.

If you're a foodie like me, you will NOT be impressed by Hillside Spot. My boyfriend and I came here a couple of weeks ago for a quick lunch after a trip to Ikea. We ordered the Blue Sky burger and a salad/sandwich combo. Let me just say the chopped salad was delicious--but then again how can you go wrong if you use fresh ingredients? The grilled veggie sandwich, however was DIS-GUSTING. The veggies were sopping in oil/grease and were put on the driest piece of bread I've ever had. I couldn't believe that's what they considered the healthy option. The Blue Sky burger was no better...but then again we wouldn't know because the only flavor you could taste was the blue cheese. This place was the biggest disappointment in a long time.  Overall, even with three and a half stars this place is overrated. Just sayin.

The only thing I'll ever go back here for is the beer! You can mix and match from their beer selection for a customized 6-pack. I can't remember how much it is but I believe it is under $10.   The food/dining experiences are ALWAYS unpleasant. I've been to this restaurant to eat maybe 4-5 times and each time is absolutely terrible. I've stopped going ever since they screwed up my order the last time. It's like the servers don't speak English or something. You can tell them day in and day out, "I can't eat dairy, mayo, or butter" and they still shlop mayo and butter all over your dish. I remember ordering a pulled pork and they smeared mayo all over the bun. I mean, who even wants mayo on their pulled pork?? That's just disgusting, I'm sorry. Anyway, after countless times of trying to tell them how I want my food, trying to notify managers, even emailing the customer service email on their website (and got no response), I gave up! It really is a shame because I think they have the potential to put out some really good food!

I've been coming her over the years and the service has consistently gone down hill. Today's treatment by the manager was by far the most blatant display of disrespect I have witnessed. We showed up with 6 people and a dog. We had all hiked 7 miles and the people and dog were just tired and hungry. After we sat down on the patio, we were questioned about the dog who is owned by a veteran. We joked saying we could just call him a service dog, but our group is not lone to take advantage. The hostess left, and in comes the manager tell us that the dog had to go and there was a seat outside the patio area for three. (Literally 6 feet from the table we were at. Our group was split with no effort to at least more us close enough to have a conversation even though there is plenty of room. We accepted it, we were quiet. In comes a woman with a small dog and the same interaction occurs, but this time, the manager accepts that the dog will sit on her lap on the patio. double standard? Absolutely, especially since the dog was not in her lap. Rude, inconsistent and fair food at best. Our waitress however was very accommodating and  tried to make the best out a blatantly disrespectful situation. Enforce or don't enforced

The service isn't fantastic especially when it's crowded but that's why I make a point to go when I have plenty of time just to lounge and relax - the atmosphere of the restaurant lends itself to that kind of dining experience anyways.    But on to the meat of it... the food!!  Pulled pork sandwich was absolutely fantastic.  Great flavor but with a nice twist to it and the guacamole was very light, yet still substantial and had a kick of flavor to it (might've been pineapples in this, I can't remember).  Croque monsiuer was also melt-in-your-mouth good. Just very fresh fare overall.  Can't love the service, but go there when you have time to lounge, chat with some friends, and share some good food!

I've enjoyed my breakfast experience several times at Hillside Spot  due to the variety of creative food.  I would like to continue enjoying the dining experience at Hillside, so I want to offer some simple suggestions.  When tables are bused make sure they get wiped down and silverware  and napkins are restocked.  When the food runner brings out the order make sure to read the ticket so you know that the order is complete.  Pay attention to small details like bring the correct bill to the table and notice when water glasses need to be refilled.  Have the staff work together as a team so everyone will notice dishes that need to picked up, empty or missing silverware containers, and making sure that outside areas are free of items left behind by the local birds.  You have great food please pay attention to the small details that make a business great.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!! We had the same server as last time we came it had been a few months we figured we would try it Again Thursday at 345 late lunch not a very busy time worst I have ever gotten!! I work in a restaurant and I am so tolerant to mediocre service but this was just BAD having worked in the service industry for 12 years this was awful took 5+ minutes just to get greeted me and my two guests all ordered beers my beer was kicked ok no problem took a while longer my girlfriends beer wasn't even the right one.. I order a different beer because after 10+ minutes she tells me the keg is no good (basically they don't have another one) meanwhile my friend had already ordered his second beer still hadn't gotten it long story short we were there for 30+ minutes my friend had 1 beer my girlfriend 0 and me half of a hefe from a kicked keg.. Definitely won't be back wanted to take my friend from out of town for a late lunch they seemed like we could get a good happy hour there but never again

I started going there just because it's nearby, but now it's become a bit of a destination for me.  I find the atmosphere is just right, and this time of year (early Fall) they keep the rollup doors open allowing interior to flow into the patio area--though flies can get annoying. They also have good WiFi with power outlets thoughtfully provided all around the long bench area. It's a good place to camp out with a laptop and work or browse for a bit, which is frequently what draws me there.   Upon entering I always get a whiff of something delicious. This varies through the day. In the morning it's bacon. Lunchtime smells like bbq. Dinner can smell like chorizo.  The kitchen in an open area where you can see -- and smell -- everything as it happens.  The sandwiches are larger than most people's heads and ingredients are very good. I enjoy the cold turkey sandwich on wholegrain with the guacamole.  The chilaquiles aren't really chilaquiles. They aren't the ones I remember from student days in Mexico. They're more like tostadas.  Taste good enough, but a bit disappointing.  Service is always good. The music can be a bit loud, but the selections are appropriate for the kind of place.  All in all, one of my favorite places in the area morning, noon and night.
Well this is a good way to start your day.  And you can pair your delicious huevos rancheros with a beer. Or mimosa.

The food here is good but the service is always lacking. Without fail someone other than the server drops off the food and then you are abandoned by the server. FYI - when someone's food is delivered, they will most likely need salsa, butter, jelly, etc...  Every time I have to go inside and track someone down to get something while our food gets cold outside. Today was the last straw so we won't bother visiting again.
The food was great but the waitress with the short red hair seemed to hate her job so maybe she should look for another position.  But I will come again and request someone else.

If you are looking for a snob coffee barista this is your spot. I ordered a carmel macchiatto "ICED", and was told this can't be done as its traditionally an expresso with carmel and foam on the top. AS i recall being in the 21st century there was the invention of ice cubes and the barista magically was able to make this happen. Listen asshole i am from seattle and have ordered more Carmel Macchiattos "With ICE" with out some snob ass little kid defining a technical process for how coffee is made.

Cool place, comfortable. Sorely needed in the 'Tuke.  Went for lunch today.  Slow ordering process and a bit crowded with food items on shelves right behind the ordering line...need to move that stuff and free up space for people to comfortably read the menus and get ready to order.  The ice tea set up needs some reorganization...it's a deadend into the windows and tables and people cannot flow through as they should to keep things moving.  Turkey sandwich was good - not great, but good.  Appeared pretty lonely on a lunch plate with a sliver of a pickle...come on it's a pickle you can charge more but at least give us a bit more than a sliver.  Ordered my sandwich and asked for mustard but no mayo - they skipped the mustard AND the mayo.  How about a few chips, or a bit of pasta salad on the plate to keep my turkey sandwich company....  If you go with a group, expect your meals to come out one at a time vs. all meals for the table at once...I noticed a lot of guests sitting there with 1 or 2 meals served while the others at their tables sat and waited...get it together Hillside - use one "poker chip" for the whole table and bring the food at once...  It's a cool place, they'll work out the bugs.  I'll go back to try breakfast and maybe even dinner (after Feb. 1st)...but they need to just observe the flow in the place...oh yeah, and for such a 'cool' place...who needs gas station energy drinks on the counter....de-clutter dudes it will be 'cooler' yet.  It's nice, needs to work out the kinks, but I hope it makes it...good crowd and lots more coming in as I left...

So badly, do I want to give these guys five stars. And each time I visit I am hopeful for a better experience.  Unfortunately, this place has consistently poor service.  Long waits for food, incorrectly taken orders and generally inattentive servers are just a few of the problems.    What continues to frustrate me more than anything is the beer cooler in the front of the store, and the borderline dishonest pricing advertised.   Above the cooler on a chalk board they advertise two of the bombers to go for $8.99*.  Select bottles do not apply.  But they don't label the prices!  You don't find out that both bombers you chose were exempt from the deal until you are making the purchase.  I've mentioned this frustration  to the staff in the past, only to be rudely spoken down to by someone claiming to be an assistant manager and one of the beer buyers.  If this place wasn't just a couple blocks from my home I would have never returned after my initial bad experience.  But they are close and convenient, and at certain times they are the only alternative to fast food in the immediate area.  Their food has been pretty good for the most part....I just wish they could get their service and their craft beer issues solved so I can start recommending this place to friends again.
My favorite brunch place in Ahwatukee. Food is consistently very good.

Had a great breakfast this morning. The breakfast burrito was very taste, so was the Mexican omlette with toast. They had a choice of grape or strawberry jam we chose the strawberry jam. It was delicious with big pieces of strawberry. Will be going back!
Always good food at Hillside Spot. Huevos rancheros, pancakes, chorizo omelette and hash browns are highly recommended. Also, great mimosas and beer on tap and tons of options in bottle.

Had breakfast with my daughter here last weekend and we were pleasantly surprised. The place was very crowded and with a line waiting to be seated which lets you know there is something good about it.  The service was not great but not bad considering how crowded it was, but the food was delicious. We order the egg and chorizo torta which is a basically a sandwich but with a different kind of bread. Knowing what a torta really is supposed to taste,  this was very close  and very good. The percentage of chorizo to the egg was perfect!    We also ordered a bowl of fruit and it was good, no cantaloupe, honey dew or grapes, it had different berries and types of fruit. All the dishes they serve to other people also looked very good.  The only thing I thought was very expensive was the latte and the chia  and had to send it back once as they brought something I did not order. I will definitely will go back and try some other food!

I'm so happy to have Hillside on our side of town!  As someone in the restaurant business, I can be hard to impress.  But these guys are great!  The food was excellent and the service was friendly without being intrusive.  Love the little details like the recycled wine bottles for glasses and the Queen Creek Olive Oil.  Get the grazers - the bread, the cheeses, and the homemade pesto were all awesome!  Love this unpretentious, yummy, and sexy new hangout!   See Nathan at the bar - he rocks!  Keep up the great work guys!

We had a five-star experience, so came back less than 24 hours later. That one was more like 4 stars, so four it is.   I had the Croque Madame both times. The first time, it was absolutely spectacular. Everything I wanted. Perfectly cooked, egg was runny and amazing. Just delightful. The next day, it was considerably slower inside, but my edges were slightly burnt and my egg wasn't runny at all. A little bummed at the night-and-day from one day to the next.   The Mexican corn with Oaxaca was pretty awesome. Got it on recommendation of our server the second day, and was super pleased. Outrageously messy, but good.   The mister got something yummy the first day which I don't remember (but clearly was good enough he didn't complain about going back the next day), and the special turkey reuben the second time. Reuben was interesting - coleslaw instead of sauerkraut. I wasn't totally sold on the idea, but he was happy with it.   We sat on the back patio until our food came. The swarm of flies was tolerable when we didn't have food on the table, but I spent more time swatting them away and defending my plate than I did eating what was on it, so we moved inside. Sat inside the second day and still noticed a few flies on the window, but the experience was much more tolerable.   Friendly service, tasty food, and breakfast available all day. (Super important to a third-shifter!) We'll be back.

We don't live in the area of Hillside so whenever we come down to Chandler we love to eat breakfast/brunch here. Nice, diverse menu. Good lattes. Beats all those chain restaurants. Try the croque madame!

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Ahwatukee. They have great food (nothing is frozen or microwaved), and amazing beer on tap. They also have great craft beer night on Thursday night, and you can mix and match a 6 pack for $9! Highly, highly recommend.

I'm a regular here. The food is reliably fresh and delicious. Love the vibe and neighborhood feel. EVERYTHING on the menu is good and some of my favorites are the farmer omelet, huevos rancheros, carne asada salad, and their cold processed coffee is spectacular. This place makes me so happy and it also has dog-friendly tables outside.

I heard great things about Hillside Spot from a friend. I will never consider his recommendations again.  The service was terrible.   Our waiter fucked everything up.. everything. Forgetful.. messed up each order. The family next to us had similar problems.. but worse. Waiter gave all the kid's food to another table. So the parents were already done eating when their kids finally received their grub.   The food was nothing special.. Maybe worth 2.5 stars. This Spot was boo boo. I've had better experiences at Waffle House.

I love this place. It's fresh, local, and tasty. The service has improved tremendously over the past year! My fianc and I go here on a regular basis and we are never let down. I recommend the turkey press with fig jam and the mesquite grilled chicken.

I went here for dinner. YES! Dinner! And I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the overabundance of  delightful quaintness.  I've been here before, once, for breakfast and I was left with a general "meh" impression, too. But at 8:20pm on a weekend night I was indecisive and decided to try this place out with their dinner menu.  I ordered some Four Peaks beer (which I'm really happy this place does all local stuff) and a Suki Rice Bowl. Delicious! I loved it! Then ordered a latte that was served beautifully. Then decided to do some cake. BAM! Awesome.  And the atmosphere was great. Low candle light, doors open to let the beautiful night air in, friendly and helpful staff. Maybe I just hit gold that night, or maybe I was drunk, but it was a lovely place for dinner and to hang out with my husband, who also really enjoyed his meal. All the other people that were there seemed to be enjoying the vibe and just happy to hang out.  I don't know that I will go back for breakfast, but I'm certainly going to head back there sometime for dinner.

Boy have they improved since they opened!  I just met a friend here for brunch this morning and it was great. We both had mimosas which were excellent and I had some egg white omelet loaded with fresh veggies. I'm proud to have this great restaurant right in my hood!
Cafferteria eatery price right fresher ingredient than McDonald for about $2 more. No signature dishes but cooked OK. Nothing to write home about.

User to love this spot but may have come under new management recently. Ordered my go to breakfast burrito today and it came out without chorizo and avocado. The waiter wasn't quick to apologize or offer a good solution so I just asked for a side of avocado. That didn't make it out before all of my friends were done eating. Super disappointing. We also ordered mimosas which were unsatisfying as well. While they were tasty there was so little mimosa in the glass that it felt like a total waste of money ordering one. This was overall an unexpected downer. Unfortunately won't be coming back. Used to love this place so very sad.
Amazing place, would love to go if possible. Had their chilaquiles and they left me amazed! Definitely would go back. They even had freshly squeezed orange juice!   Must go!

As a Hillside regular I feel 4/5 stars is not quite the perfect rating - I wish I could give them 4.5 stars as 90% of my experiences with the food and service have been excellent.    Those experiences that comprise the 90% include breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  Amazing pancakes, best bacon in the valley (seriously, big props for the bacon), huevos rancheros yum, chilaquiles to die for, awesome burgers, great beer selection, and I am in love the Cocina 10 items!  The servers are friendly, knowledgeable about the menu (both food and beverage), and make the overall experience at Hillside enjoyable.  The other 10% - the bad - have occurred in the mornings on the weekends when they're in the middle of a rush.  New rule - if I have to wait more than 5 mins for a table at Hillside I have to walk away.  They just don't seem to properly staff those peak times and both service and food quality suffer.  Final words... outside of 8:30am-10:30am on Saturday and Sunday I will continue to visit Hillside for any meal of the day.  Great food!  If you haven't been... go!

This place struggles.  We have come and have good food but terrible service.  Other times we have terrible service but good food.  The last stop falls under the former, we stopped by to check out their happy hour specials which were great for beer and wine, but our server didn't mention any food specials like the HH Menu photos state.  The boy ordered the Brisket Burrito special which he liked, but was mostly full of filler and not a lot of brisket.  I ordered the Blue Sky Cheeseburger with fries and was disappointed.  The beef had no seasoning what so ever and tasted flat.  The french-fries were cold and soggy and the side of ranch dressing was runny and flavorless.  The Boy watched our food sit in the warmer window for about 5 min before it was served.  There are some menu items that are truly worth the trip but with the Russian roulette of bad service good food and good service bad food it makes it hard to want to come back.

So here it is, sometimes if you have more than one bad experience in a row you just have to say goodbye.  Well that was a few years ago and I have been back to Hill Side for coffee and desert a few times and we have enjoyed it!  I like the atmosphere and the fact that you can have coffee, desert and good conversation.
This is one of my favorite places! The staff is always amazing and the food is to die for! Breakfast here is the best!

The restaurant is cute in a nice neighborhood. Service was really good. My friend ordered huevos rancheros and he said it was pretty good. I had a Croque Madame and I was pretty disappointed because it didn't have any bechamel sauce. It was just an open faced ham and cheese sandwich with an egg on it. The coffee was decent. For $14 I thought my food wasn't that great but I enjoyed the overall experience.

One of my favorite local spots. Good food, good atmosphere, original menu with fresh ingredients and just one of those places that makes you want to come back again. I love supporting local, and have had great experiences every time I've come here. The Asada salad is one of my favorites. If breakfast is more your taste, the chilequiles are SO GOOD!

I went to the Hillside Spot last week with a friend last week. I had read all abut their less than stellar service, but the service was actually very good for us. We just both thought the food was mediocre. I got a burger with bacon, caramelized onions, and an egg on it and my friend got the croque monsieur. The burger was good but nothing terribly special and the fries were kind of soggy and flavorless. My friend thought the same about her food. I got a slice of chocolate cake to go and it tasted very box -ish. It wasn't bad and it was very large, but it didn't have a homemade flavor. Although this place was alright, I don't think I would be back too soon.
Pulled pork, corn on the cob with the cotija, salsa, french fries, coffee. They do everything well.

I keep coming back because it's a fun place in Ahwatukee and the food is always good, but takes forever to get served (even when it's not busy). Love the decor and quality of the food, but the service is always disorganized (not sure if it's the kitchen or servers). If you want a quick bite, this is unfortunately not the place... Ordering a simple dish will keep you there for close to 2 hours.

This was my first time in and I was very impressed! I had the oatmeal which was absolutely amazing, and I loved how friendly and speedy the service was! Will definitely be going back soon to try out some of the other options on the menu.

After being a customer for many years, we will not be back.  My wife's salad had a lot of rusty lettuce.  She sent it back for a burger.  My chicken dinner with fries was cold and should have been sent back too.    We question the staffs' understanding of food safety.

Had not been to Hillside for awhile. Went this morning, busy but no wait. Had the Farmers omelet. And a cup of coffee. The food was great , service outstanding and price was right. Nice to see $1.75 for Coffee instead of $3.00 at other places.

I was brought to this place by a friend who set some high expectations. Those expectations were exceeded.  We stopped in for a late breakfast on a Saturday morning and only had about a 5 minute wait. It's not a very big dining area and we ended up sharing a large table with another party of two (a couple chairs separating us).  I decided on the "build your own omelette" option which had plenty of ingredients to choose from. They definitely don't short side you on the portions either; my omelette was stuffed. My friend got banana pancakes (a la jack johnson) which were also outstanding.    It's a great local concept and features ingredients from local farmers as well as microbrew 6-packs for purchase. Awesome atmosphere, friendly service, and great food. Highly recommend Hillside to all my fellow yelpers.

The food was good.  Nothing fancy, but certainly of quality.  They have a simple menu, we ordered a variety of items, all of which were prepared well and tasted good.  We did share a pancake.   It was a memorable pancake.  Light and tasty!    I ordered ham and eggs.  Ham was less salty, which I prefer.  The 9 grain toast was delicious.  My sig-o ordred the egg white vege omelet with fruit.   Fresh, good quality and the sun-dried tomatoes were "yummy."  Good service.   If there weren't as many flies, there'd be 4 stars.

We decided to check out a local joint for brunch. It's our first weekend in our new place in Ahwatukee. This place is great for ambience. It's a cool looking joint. The coffee is TERRIFIC! The food - at least what we had - was mediocre. The disappointment was that this place has the makings to be a great joint - not just ok.   My husband had the Corque sandwich. It was ok but the sandwich didn't have enough spread & was a bit dry. He also ordered hashbrowns. Wow, how can you mess up hashbrowns? Well, make them like shoestrings & serve them cold. That's how ya jack up hashbrowns.   Anyway, I had the egg, avacado & chorizo burro. The menu offers brisket & pulled pork. I asked to sub the chorizo with brisket & was told that the brisket & pulled pork weren't ready yet. Another disappointment. So I chose chicken. My food arrived & it was ok but flavorless. No seasoning - at least none I could distinguish. Their fire roasted salsa came with it & it was very good. (I ordered a point to take home with me). It was what made the burro edible.   Service was slow. They were busy but I waited almost 20 min for my salsa & the check. My server was nice & she was good at checking on us & keeping the coffee flowing. Just slow at the end of our meal with the check, salsa & change.   Will we go back? Maybe. I think we may try their lunch. You know how it is - sometimes a place is good at one or the other - lunch or breakfast - but maybe not both. But so far we rate it a 3 star.... maybe lunch will change my mind.

This is a great place if you've got time to spare and don't mind waiting. I really wanted to like this place and even had a four-star review for it previously. However, I've come back four times and each time gets significantly worse - mainly the time it takes to get served. The most recent time, I sat outside for more than 15 minutes before I even got a menu. I also find myself saying "no, I only have an hour, I can't go to Hillside". Such a shame because they are super close to me, their atmosphere is nice, and food is pretty good. Their staff is friendly and I believe they're doing their best, but maybe they're not used to the size of the restaurant it is because it can be a 10-15 minutes between the times your server comes by. Making it easily an hour or two ordeal, even if you're by yourself. But hey, if  you've got a good two or three hour window to have a sit down meal, this is the place to come!

Enjoyed an amazing dinner there Wednesday evening. Service was superb and the food was delicious! Definitely returning for dinner. Salmon was the fish of the day - highly recommend whenever they have  that available. Lovely patio to enjoy the Spring time temperatures.
